An amazing expression of an Italian wine. The nose has an earthy green scent with a slight animal skin with underlying black cherry. The palate immediately greets you with a combination of freshly ground black pepper and green bell pepper. There is a nice balanced level of tannins that are well rounded with a medium level of acidity. The finish lingers just enough to display fresh cherries. Highly recommend giving this a try.

It's taken me a few days to reflect on Saturday's #CorkbuzzCharlotte, Tour of Italy wine tasting...what a great day of wonderful wine and fantastic banter.   This wine is fantastic...red, lush fruit, subtle vanilla flavors...medium to full bodied, smooth and long lasting!!!

Initial nose was very funky ;-) Gorgeous fruit, though. Opening up just right- light cherry, tobacco, spice. Tasting this with pork tenderloin is just a bright, happy experience. Age is adding a nice dimension here too-- violets, plum and almost a hint of cassis. Beautiful.

Clean garnet hue with beautiful tears, she has harmonic nose of cherry, mushroom, licorice, wood, herbs, pepper, forest floor; on day 2 afternoon, with cherry, minerals, medicinal herbs; at night with violet, licorice, anise and cream. On the palate, she is silky smooth, balanced, fruity, lively acidity, a very long finish with heat, spiciness and bitterness. It takes 6 hours for her to open and she is at her best on day 2 night. Too early to open as she needs more time to soften her tannins. Give her time.

Light garnet colour. Aromas of raspberry, cherry, smoke, oak, mineral, metal, perfume. Palate is high acidity, medium + alcohol and body, tannins are very strong, balance is very good, finish is medium+. This is very nice.

Absolutely signature Brunello that opens with red cherries, wild berries & potpourri on the nose. Pronounced notes of tree bark, balsam herbs, walnuts & forest floor lend more strength to the bouquet.
Intense, flavorful & fruity Sangiovese palate follows suit with more red cherries, tobacco, dried violets, nougat, wet wood & leaves, sun-baked bricks & black tea, eclipsing in a spicy yet fruity finish.
Grippy tannins & medium acidity carry the palate.
Overall a very good Brunello, open for >3 hours.

The Brunello di Montalcino is very solid, beautifully ripe and intense with classic aromas of rose petals, wild berries, cherries, almonds and orange peel. Deep on the palate, elegant, dense, with firm tannins and fresh clean finish.

I was tasting this vintage side by side with its sibling bottling "Madonna delle Grazie". The difference for me between the two, was I found this to be to my tastes. In this bottle I found the acids to be not as sharp, and a warmer berry structure that allowed this wine to be more approachable. Still typicity of Sangiovese abounds in this wines amarena cherry, raspberry, currants, green herbs, big acids, chewy tannin, and a persistent length. Wine aged for 39 months in barrel, and 10 months in bottle. 14.5%

I was worried about this one.  It was a Brunello mystery wine from Garagiste and I got a case.  I was concerned that it was too old and would be musty and flat.  Wrong.  Pours a nice aged ruby transitioning to brick orange at the rim.  Nose is complex with cedar, chocolate, dried fruit, and potpourri.  On the palate, the wine has a very well balanced spicy, fruity, stewed (but not sweet) fruit flavor that is exotic and delicious.  Solid but not overbearing tannic structure even at 14 years.

Blueberry and black cherry with a touch of gingerbread. Although the flavors are bold, it's relatively light and easy to drink. The finish keeps that spice and draws in the scent of tea with the black cherry. Very good blend!

Poped and poured, this is a wine that needs lots of air. Restrained nose with black currant, cherries, some green notes and some heat and alcohol. 

Clean and pure mouthfeel, loads of fine tuned tannins and a bitter touch in the finish.

Needs more cellaring and plenty of air to open up. 93p

2015 vintage
Color is pale garnet
Nose had cherry, licorice, dried herbs, and sandalwood
Palate has Raspberry and dried cherry, with an almost saline quality.
Tannins are heavy but integrate nicely.
This is a very fresh wine that is a perfect wine to try if you want a traditional BdM that exhibits the true fruit of the Sangiovese varietal
Will age wonderfully and definitely needs a good decant and great Italian food to pair
Cheers.

4,1: A Brunello with a gorgeous energetic bouquet offering herry, redcurrant, prunes, sun-dried tomato, orange peel, roasted mushrooms, fresh leather, Italian spices, black tea with a lovely dusty minerality and an acetone-like finish. The palate is quite feminine with medium concentration and nice firm tannins and a clean acidity. Unripe red berries, rhubarb, green olives, black coffee and pepper. 
- See full review with info, more tasting notes and pictures at Vinofili (Instagram). Cheers! :-)

Zoom wine exchange tasting
01.12.2020
Theme Sangiovese

Mine TB. Very fragrant floral potpourri, violet lavender, sandalwood. Light to medium mouthfeel very fresh silky well knitted tannins, with sweet sour balsamic sl bitter grapefruit endpalate. Smoky finale, not much chocolate, mocha notes, but sour plum prunes emerge. Elegant aromatic. Lighter traditional style.

4.2‚òÜ refreshing stylish, very nice. Can cellar for differentiating texture in next 5 - 15 years.
RP96, Kerin O'Keefe98, XW96

4.2 for this 2015 vintage which no doubt over time is going to be one of the greatest. For now it is just too young to drink, however it shows fresh cherries, raspberries and dark chocolate underpinned by perky tannins that will soften over time.

20220204 - Unfortunately this was a pale shadow of the bottle opened 2 weeks ago

Had hoped to showcase a floral ethereal elegant Brunello to Eng who had not been keen on recent muscular expressions of BdM

However it was not friendly at all today

Closed with a mere hint of dried red fruit .. raspy acidity and tarry grippy tannins cloaked everything

All thought it was a Nebbiolo although some thought the coarse tannins were suggestive of Chianti

Mine @ Eng's Italian themed session in GOODAM SS2 Hub

I tried the 2007 and 2008 before, which I struggled a little bit with. You know, the hard struggle we, Vivino users, have with average 3.0-3.5* ratings!! 

The outstanding year of 2010 for BdM shines through on this bottle too. It's definitely better than previous vintages.

Leather, earth and a nice note of meat on the nose. Very classic from start to finish. With the finest touch of funky notes too. Hardly noticeable. 2010... Approachable and recommended. Do it!

A real knockout. I'd rank this in the top 3 of the nearly dozen 2010 BDMs I've tasted. 

Made in the traditional style, its nose smelled of perfume...plums, dark cherries, thyme, cedar & forest floor. The fruit was intense; the tannins velvety and sweet; and the acidity awesomely fresh. For such a young wine I found it seamless. Limpid and suave in texture. So well balanced and accessible that I wouldn't hesitate drinking this at an early age. A beautiful BdM.

Il Marroneto owns 9 hectares of vineyards in Montalcino, they make three traditionally styled wines in Montalcino. Brunello Di Montalcino Madonna delle Grazie from a single vineyard, Brunello Di Montalcino and Rosso Di Montalcino.

En magnum - This 2005 Il Marroneto Brunello Di Montalcino is compact and elegant. Gentle cherry, rose, and slight tar. Coming from a weaker vintage in Brunello di Montalcino, it lacks a bit of fruit structure and depth, more rustic and higher acidity than expected.

84/100
A-maz-zing, perfect, powerful, a touch of fruit in the right place
Too expensive. Nothing extraordinary, There are at least as good or even better Brunellos at much lower or half price. Sorry!
Great brunello with colleagues

First bottle: Masterpiece.  Lush, complex and vibrant.  Five stars

Second bottle:  tart and tight with "cooked" fruit flavors?  Weird.  Three stars

Average 4

Any way I steel enjoy
Oaky and dry. Was worried it was a past peak but the flavor was true.
Gorgeous wine! Refined with great balance of structure, fruit, tobacco and leather. So good on its own, or with cheese. Glad I waited until now to open it.

Part of group flight tasting. Still early to drink this but approachable now despite high level of chalky tannins. Deep ruby-red with garnet-red highlights. Warm, complex nose intermixing red fruit, cooked plum, a balsamic touch and fresh mushroom. Robust, fresh palate with supple tannins revealing more of the wonderful fruit expression.

4,25* Medium garnet. Red cherries, leather, earth, oak spice and vanilla on the nose. Medium intensely and body. Elegant and well structured with mainly cherry fruit and dried prunes together with leather and spice on the palate. Medium+ acidity and tannins that are a bit dry. Developed wine with complexity. Beautiful subtle nose of plums, cherries and leather. Still dark purple after 20years in the bottle. Soft texture and tannins, still lots of cherries, cinnamon, oak. It really opened up after 2 hours of airtime.

A beautiful Brunello di Montalcino from Il Marinetto. Brownish red color makes this ‚Äò11 Wine appear as if an older vintage. Heady aroma. >floral than fruity w/ hints of sandalwood. Paired well w/ mushroom toast & it‚Äôs acidity balanced well w/ a grilled lamb belly. This is such a delicious & smooth drinking wine that it‚Äôll be almost finished before you know it. But try to savour this slowly and you‚Äôll be rewarded by its complexity & the aromas of rich stewed fruits towards the end. 12/17 @Venue by Sebastian

What an amazing wine! This is "only" regular Marroneto, but presents absolutely top quality. wild strawberry, violets, wild rose, candized orange, ylang, walnut, dried mushrooms, black tea, tobacco, tamarind. Evolves through an hour in the glass. Refreshing,  with beautiful, superb tanins, perfect acidity and well integrated alcohol. Alessandro Mori is a true genious!

Was very hesitant to open this for fear that it wouldn‚Äôt be ready. Medium notes of pine, cherry, pomegranate, copper with metallic minerality. The structure is there - great tannins & acidity, but this needs to stay horizontal another decade. 92

Light strawberry and you can coax cherry out with a little nudge.  The nose is so light, elegant and beautifully perfumed.  Violet, plum and earth (minerality), leather and high acid on the palate.  With as much flavor and tertiary influences it has, it still seems a bit underripe and needing more age.  Light wood influence too and wonderful warmth on finish

Definitely drinking in its prime.  I think the pro reviews don't do this wine justice.  It has aged very well - going on 13 years in bottle.  Super smooth tannins with lots of secondary characters on the nose and fruit on the palate.  Paired extremely well with veal in wild mushroom sauce!

What is that? Velvet? That‚Äôs the first thought that came to mind. The wine was a light red with a slight brown rim. Soft, supple and velvety on the palate. Notes of cherry on the nose and brandied cherries on the palate. Tannins are still very firm, but agreeable with a long elegant finish.

Had the privilege of tasting this wine with the owner of the winery and I was truly blown away. Aided by an excellent year, this wine charms you with a complex bouquet of red berry fruits, forest fruits and ripe cherries. Taste it when opened and after an hour of decanting and experience the beautiful development of the aromas and flavour. Should be cellared but seriously, who can resist opening it now?

Ruby, spicy & hot on the nose (14% alcohol?), red berry fruits, wonderful smoothness on the palate, with firm but balanced tannins and good acidity, really impressive and a bit of a revelation as I'm not that familiar with Sangiovese/Brunellos. Delicious! One thing I did notice was the the cork was less 'infused' with 'sediment' than equivalent wines from say Bordeaux, as well as the colour being considerably thinner and absolutely no sediment. Probably an obvious statement, but struck me nonetheless...

Nose: developing, medium intens, clean condition. Aromas of red fruit, cassis, plum, wetstone, coffee, capsicum, hint of undergrowth, cedar, vanilla, graphite. 
Palate: dry, medium intens, medium (+) acidity, medium (+) velvety tannins, medium (+) body, medium (+) finish. 
Assessment: outstanding wine. Potential for aging.

Stunning classic Bordeaux... Very approachable but nothing easy about this wine. Lovely integrated fruit.. black currant,  cassis and plum combine effortlessly into leather and cedar. Beautiful now but will only get better with time.

Impressive, very well done, elegant, fresh, with a long finish. Very pretty and polished, with great aromatic complexity, finely grained tannins a good balance. Loads of black fruit (black cherry, blackberry, cassis), licorice, leather, pencil lead, cedar, chocolate. Very smooth, good stuff.

Family saga dates back to the 16th century. The name Grand-Puy, mentioned in documents from the Middle Ages, comes from ancient term "puy" which means "hillock, small height". Since the 16th century the property was passed from generation to generation, until the 1920s when the Borie's bought the property.  Ripe juicy fruit aromas with spice. Black berry fruits, great balance, nice oak integration. Lingering ripe tannins ending with spicy mineral character.

Horizontal Bordeaux tasting of 2011 vintage, wine #8. A blend of 78% CS and 22% Merlot, wine is aged for 18 months in oak, 70% new. Deep ruby colour. Medium body, starts with velvety and refined texture, fresh and dried fruit flavours, some funky hints, powdery well structured tannins, long finish with touch of chalk and smoke.

C: Deep ruby
N: Med intense heavy black fruits, smoke, cigar, pepper, earthy oak, green peppercorn, leather & light cocoa. Complex, v masculine & elegant.
P: blackcurrant, plum -> spices, pepper, cocoa, leather -> vanilla, blackberry & cigar. High conc, long, full bod, high acid & med+ velvety tannins. V well balanced, elegant, masculine, strong black fruits & tertiary notes. Great QPR, has upside but in window. Now to 2033. 93p.

U-m, mesmerizing beauty of oaky & leathery flavour. üòçüòçüòç. Well-aged, yet still fresh, tasty & savory black fruits juice, fabulous balance. It displayed aroma of blackberry, raspberry jam, oak, leather, clove, smoke, cassis, pencil, laced this smoke. Smooth, silky, dry. High & grained tannin, relatively high acidity, full body. Fenale lingering spices. Pls visit 5Y later.

12/21. Dark ruby color no signs of bricking. Wet slate, rose petals, and hint of wet oak on nose. Firm but velvety with solid core of red and blue fruits. Faint aftertaste hint of toffee and cigar smoke. Maybe graphite pencil shavings too. 12 years old but has 10-15 ahead of it. Very nice.

Deep ruby colour, pronounced intensity of flavours and aromas of blackberry, black plum, black cherry, blueberry, black currant, violet, Green bell pepper, pencil shaving, licorice, vanilla, clove, cedar, smoke, leather, tobacco, earthy, fig, and wet leaves. This wine is developing. Dry, high tannin, medium alcohol, high acidity, full bodied, and long finish. This wine has an outstanding quality. Drink now and has potential for further ageing.

Elegant Bordeaux wine at its best, classical style, dry, medium-bodied, great balance of acidity and tannins, hints of leather, soil, cranberry, blackcurrant leaves, moss. Were enjoying it before and after decanting, needs air to open up the bouquet. Only one thing was missing is some juicy medium-rare piece of beef. Next time definitely will pair it.

Still young, benefitted from 2-3 hours of decanting.
The nose shows a generous range of tobacco, leather with a hint of mint and oak. The jammy cassis is so fruity it reminds me of juicy strawberry. Nice freshness.
The palate has the character of a young cab, the tannins are still sharp and comes with frank acidity. Apart from the cedar, pen shavings and cassis there are some red cherries, forest floor  and a slight white pepper touch.
It will probably benefit from another 5 years of cellaring.

Medium to dark red. Beautiful nose of plums, leather, black fruits, some herbs, graphite. Brighter red fruits on the palate, fresh acidity, earthy, integrated tannins, great concentration and length. 90 p

An incredible Boudreaux that is starting to show its age, but still full of fresh fruit. Lot of blackberry, cassis, and plum, balanced with earthy and leathery tones. Still acidity and round tannins. Medium long finish.

Very modern style. Fruit driven, balanced acidity, refined tannins. Great wine all round from start to finish. Nose of dusty gravel, fresh blackberries, chassis, crushed flowers, hint of graphite and a dose of menthol and new cedar. Mid palate is fresh with the same fruit and minerality some white ground pepper. Slightly saline towards the finish but long lasting.

It is young after just 11 years and this can age well, maybe 10 to 15 yrs more, but no reason to because it is drinking in exceptional form now.

Soft and fully loaded with cassis, BlackBerry, pomegranate and rhubarb.  Leather and tobacco notes.  Toasted almonds and vanilla oak saturate this bomb. It took 2 hours including decanting to come to life. Loved this wine which will last another 10-15 years at a minimum.

Trader Joe's lucky find at $59.99/bottle!  Leather, tobacco, cassis, and plum on the nose. Cassis confirmed on the palate, along with graphite and pepper. Full-bodied with medium acidity. An absolute steal at this price.

Bdx 1990 tasting - the final sample was this Pauillac which rates around 95 Parker points and rightly so. Black forrest fruits are still there with a mixture of aromas circling as time passes by. Fairly traditional winemaking in the cellar - fully destemmed fruit - double trie sorting - long maceration. @LeVineur This marks the second time tasting GPL (1983 as part of an earlier workshop on aging on wines by @[1|13031387|Onno Misset]).

4.4 94 pts  Outstanding, a pure delight and so lucky to find this in Dubai.

Utterly dumbfounded, this took my breath away, just beautiful.
The amount of complexity, the depth, the length, this is a wine that will haunt me. 
The lush fruit, blackberries, blueberries, sweet cassis, against the intense carbon back drop and savoury notes.

Been craving for a good bottle of Pauillac for more than a week and I decided to open this 10years GPL ü§î. Pale ruby colour with aromatic oak, balsamic spice and leather on the nose. 95 Points, drink from 2025 until 2040. Deep purple with dense core. Seductive nose of black berries and cherry, bitter almond and chocolate, hazelnut and tobacco, licorice and spicy oak. On the palate perfectly balanced and packed with aromas, polished tannins and sexy vibrant fruit. This is a baby, but I just couldn't resist and cracked a Demi from my case to get a taste of what it will be like. Excellent, finishing long and fresh.

Fab Grand Puy Larose 1998 which doesn't get an attention it deserved. Brick color, first nose reveals some chocolate, vanilla, licorice and black cherry notes. Scents of cedar, spice box, green pepper and hints of leather (hardly noticeable). Tannins are very pleasant and approachable. Evolved, well structured with layered texture. Long yet elegant spicy finish. Ready to drink, very decent and enjoyable! I would definitely grab another bottle by chance.

Bordeaux tasting 3/11: 75% CS, 20% M & 5% CF.
This gem starts really discretely but after some aeration it turns into something beautiful. More secondary flavours like leather, alum, tobacco, dried grass, sour cherries and earthy impression. Later on you have that typical irony impression. Slowly all components turn into a balanced, elegant and refined taste, soft and silky but with depth. The more time in your glass, the better the taste. Great.

Bxd at its very best. Well evolved, tannins nicely softened, full bodied though not too dry. Classic dark fruit, graphite & cigar box definitely here, savoury actually. Drinking beautifully now though may be even better in another couple of years.

4.2 Grand Puy Lacoste 2012 is a fifth growth in 1855 classification. Located nearby Bages Village, Pauillac region of Medoc, Bordeaux. 

Delicious, velvet texture with the classic cassis and cigar notes. Very elegant, bright tannins and low acidity. Amazing! Cheers

Delicious Pauillac with a fuller more robust yet elegant and woodsy profile. The wine was decanted for an hour or so and for sure that helped put a a bigger spotlight on the blackcurrant, cassis, vegetal sweet spice flavours. Finish lingered for 8+ seconds. A 4.2 now but potential for more with time.

I love the balance of this. It has tones of flavours, but none outshines the other. Wood, cedar and barn on the nose. Vanilla, oak, tobacco, pepper and a tad of chocolate. High in tannins but also hints of fruit. A bit of everything, really.

Vivino Bdx tasting #3:
My contribution was a very elegant Pauillac right in his drinking window -made from 75% CS - 20% M - 5% CF and spent 16-18M in French Barrique. 
Nose: Strong Barnyard, black fruit, tobacco and uplifting Mint in the back.

Bordeaux tasting-3.
69% of CS, 38% Merlot and 3% CF that presents itself right in its drinking window.
Taking off with tertiary dominated aromas reminiscent of musk, leather and barnyard combined with warm vegetable notes mixed with cassis, warm cherries and roses, ending with a hint of coffee and a refreshing whiff of mint.
A somewhat lighter Pauillac style (probably due to the vintage) that shows a soft and silky mouthfeel, elegance and depth, structured by lovely grip and a pinch or iron. Wow! 4.7*

Bordeaux #3:
The 3rd wine was Kristof's contribution. A blend of 75% CS, 20% Merlot and 5% CF aged for 16-18 months in oak. A bit modest in the beginning, but it was getting better in the glass. Aromas of leather, barnyard, mentol, tabacco, blackberry. Medium body with soft ripe tannins, but still deep and complex. Ripe cherry, mint, chocolate on the palate with vanilla at the finish. Elegant and refined, soft and silky.

Another winner from the 1961 Bordeaux vintage, the gift that keeps giving. Although the fruit was not as chunky and fresh as the one I tried last year, this showed class. A bottle that would convert uninformed bordeaux cynics out there that never tried a bottle at peak. There is really NO POINT in drinking these young top vintages like 00, 05, 09 and 10. Quite similar on the nose than the Lalande 75 with undergrowth, soaked dried cassis, sandalwood & bell pepper. Mellow palate of black fruits & orange peel.

(Nov 2018, Manila) This 2011 Pauillac has a deep, dark, opaque magenta robe. The nose has floral notes; as well as smoke, leather, and spices. This is a dry, and medium-bodied wine. The finish is a lingering dark cacao bitter note. A few years, or even a decade more in the cellar should tame the tannins nicely.

Very deep ruby in the glass, barely thinning at the edges. Nose of raspberry, cherry, lilac, and blueberry. On the palate, very well balanced and structured. Silky tannins, notes of leather, tobacco, and dark chocolate come forward.

Lots of strawberry on the nose. Pepper spice and cherry too. Meaty, balsamic edge. Definite graphite and pencil lead. After a bit of time it changes to dark fruit, blackberry, still pepper and heady woody notes with oak and dark chocolate. Classic Paulliac

Medium ruby with slight garnet hue. Back fruit nose (blackberry, black currant and plum), leather, dried herbs, tobacco and aniseed / licorice. Full body, dry, medium grainy tannins and acidity. Savory mouth, long peppery finish.

tobacco smoke cedar black fruit, more acetic and dry fruits than new world Bordeaux blends.  I drank it in parallel with  2014 Don Maximiano from Chile.  I prefer this old world wine though Don Maximiano is also complex.

WOW to the Pauillac! Tart cherries and subtle currants on the nose; medium-bodied; earthy and slight baby-shroom aroma. Consistent! Soft tannins and balanced in oak and leatheriness... to the finish line! No better wine with steak and MUSHROOMS!!! Love this!!!

Absolutely classic left bank Bordeaux. Cedar, cassis, rich tobacco leaf, graphite with a touch of well balanced oak. Savory notes. Charcuterie , Salame, salt, rounded dark fruit with plenty of acid hanging on. 13.5%

Spotlight of the day. I rated it very highly when I tried this Pauillac Grand Cru Classe fine wine in the Altaya annual tasting event. So I shared with the team. 

It opened up after 1 hour of decanting (yes, I brought my own decanter to this traditional Chinese restaurant). Blackcurrant, cedar, cigar box on the nose. Full bodied. Silky tannin. Concentrated. Great balance. 

The price tag was 3 times of the other bottles on the table but it definitely earned it.

Took hours to open up but man it was worth the wait. Hauntingly seductive nose of dark berry perfume, fresh raspberies, mint, and a cocktail of minerals. Power but elegance on the palate again with dark fruits as well as pine forest, tobacco, licorice, and an earthy clay-like minerality. Delicious, creamy texture with really fine tannins and acidity. The oak has been fully absorbed lifting everything on the intense finish. Drinking beautifully now though there's lot's of potential. A very fine wine indeed!

Textbook, rather masculine Pauillac. Offers this classy cassis, leather, pencil shavings nose with fine but strong tannins. Nice complexity, sweet spot and great length. Could drink this more often üòÄ

Much pleasure to drink now until 2030?

94-95 points.

Tinto oscuro color carmeci, capa alta, borde  de tonalidad teja. Nariz un tanto austera despu√©s de dos horas, frutos negros. Moras, ar√°ndanos, roble, tabaco,. En boca es fruta negra, roble, chocolate bitter, pimienta negra, acidez baja, astringencia media, seco de fondo, leve amargor, fina largo.

Wine #4 courtesy of @[1|4372591|Rock and Roll Wino], thanks for another great Bordeaux! - I‚Äôve had a young GPL and now I‚Äôve been fortunate enough to have one with the tannins fully integrated. 

This was certainly in its window, the tannins had mellowed out to create a silky smooth wine. 

On the nose: red fruit, black fruit, touch of bubblegum on the end, graphite. 

On the palate:  black fruit, red fruit, tannins really well integrated, tertiary earthy notes. 

A great example of why aged Bordeaux is so desired.

Deep garnet with clear signs of aging to edge though no orange. Classic lead pencils and leather nose: very harmonious. Medium weight palate with a lot of tertiaries and a taste of liquid leather. Tannins are largely subsided and I would call this mature. Very nice

Dark ruby robe with a touch of brick on the rim. Reasonably intense nose, with black cherry, blackcurrant, clove, a lick of vanilla and a perfumed note. Dry, med plus to full bodied, with medium plus fine tannin and high acidity. Powerful palate of ripe black cherry, cassis, pepper, menthol and sweet spice. Persistent finish of blackcurrant, menthol and a tannic lick. Quite taut. Complex, intense, balanced. Very good indeed. At the beginning of its drinking window still. Easily 10 years to go I should think

Wine 4 of our blind tasting, courtesy of @[1|4372591|Rock and Roll Wino] (and the longest tenured bottle of his cellar!) Outstanding GCC Bordeaux. Soft tannins, incredibly well structured, blackberry, cassis, plum, leather, cedar, flint, graphite. This is in the window, but not yet peaking. Fantastic wine.

Deep ruby with slight garnet hue. Black fruit nose (blackberry, blackcurrant and plum), leather, dried herbs, tobacco and aniseed/ licorice. Full body, dry, medium grainy tannins and acidity, medium + alcohol. Mouth is quite savoury, almost black olive and long, slight peppery finish.

(4.5) Great wine! 120USD (130,000 Korean won), Classic Bordeaux Pauillac. Robert parker said this winery was so underrated. It is so delicious. Solid structure, deep complexity, not too much acidity and tannins, sweetness. All of things were nice harmony. It has leather, earthy, tobacco, oak scents. It is so smooth, easy drinkable wine.

Cheers Grand Puy Lacoste! A stunning RP 95 wine right at front of the drink window (2020-2050). A super dark inky plum color the nose is explosive currants, plums, anise, vanilla, mocha, and violets. The taste is equally explosive with red and black fruits, chocolate covered strawberries and a nice mushroom earthy note. The wine finishes with a sweet tannin structure, nice and round full velvet mouthfeel and a long alluring finish. Cheers!

I‚Äôm going to preface with: I probably should‚Äôve let this decant longer - but unfortunately I was hosting, and couldn‚Äôt afford that time. On the nose: blackberry and cassis notes were present, intertwined with notes of cigar box and leather. The nose was very much present, but the individual notes were very subtle and delicate. The palette pushed the dark fruit notes to the backdrop, and moreso present notes of oak, earth, and tobacco on the forefront. A very elegant, once powerful, complex wine.

2014. Drank in 2022. Just within its drinking window. Floral notes on the nose with dark fruit, oak, leather & mushrooms. On the palate Minerality comes through with some licorice and graphite. Great stuff!!

Mooi spul. Hoe je Bordeaux wilt hebben. Echt mooi volle terroir lucht maar ook density qua smaak. Niet overheersend tertiair. Iets best CF ig qua geur. Ondanks dat het er niet in zit.
Good nose, structure, balance, acid
Another good one.

AT vs Bordeaux blind tasting flight #4

Things started to get interesting.

Very lush, ripe black fruit, tobacco, cedar wood.

Elegance and sophistication.

Definitely Pauillac.
Dark and brooding aromas of cigar smoke, pencil shavings and oak. Beautifully smooth on the palate with black fruit . Very well structured wine and an absolute pleasure to drink now
Deep garnet colour. Earthy on the nose with leather, red fruit, and violet. Red currant, blackberry, pencil lead, and a hint of eucalyptus in the finish. Velvety tannins and a long enjoyable finish.
Celebrating a special occasion.  Didn't write proper TN.  '61 is a well known standout vintage.  Very smooth, had some noteworthy leather and still black fruit.  Extremely tasty.  93pts.

Powerful 
Black cherry black plum blackberry bramble violet licorice cloves nutmeg chocolate vanilla leather earthy jam prune cooked berry

Birthday dinner wine.  Alaskan crab leg, egg noodles with lobster, garlic and extra virgin olive oill, club steak, green beans,, portobello mushrooms.
Leather, spices, dried fruit
This is the best wine I‚Äôve had in years.  Dry, bold, depth and complexity.  Wish I had bought 6 bottles five years ago

Bold Pauillac from a tough year. After a couple hours of decanting this wine opened up nicely and the strength of the Cab Sauv softened up. The nose is stewed, ripe fruit, leather and tobacco. Plus some earthy and herbaceous notes.

The pallet is all black and dried fruit. Prune, ripe fig, blackberry and cassis. A touch of Chinese five spice and anise. 

The finish is long, warm and evolving.

Plenty of life in this wine
Uau, potente, marcante com muita personalidade e um ataque poderos√≠ssimo. Ap√≥s uma hora decantado modificou-se totalmente mbtendo a acidez maravilhosa!
Big young tannins lotsvof dark fruit on nose leather tobacco some violets big firm finish needs time to enjoy fully
beautiful right bank Bordeaux. Opened up nicely with a lush nose, great mouthfeel and long lasting finish.
july 2020. dinner @ herman with a bunch of 09 bdx beauties. herman got 3 out of 5, fiona 2/5 i got it all wrong! super yumz. beautiful till the end. this one zeroised 1st!

A half bottle. PnP. Paired with roasted goose.
Dark ruby colour.
Mulberry, cassis, blackcurrant, cedar, tobacco, leather, bay leaf, rosehip...
Still young, but tannins are softened.
Lovely nose with pencil shavings, blackberry and a hint of mocha. Quite austere and a little closed. Tannins still there but starting to blend in nicely. Another 3-4 years probably needed
Had the 2009 vintage and I must say it didn‚Äôt disappoint! Classic Pauillac Cab and lots of dried black fruits. Matured tannins with hints of leather and cigar. Dry with good finish. Very nice

Clear, deep, ruby. Medium intensity on nose. Whiff of nectar or honeycomb. Taste characteristics differs from nose. Light licorice. Dark fruit. Ponderous. Would prefer more fruit to support alcohol.
Also complex spicy wine mellows into notes of black fruit, tobacco, vanilla, sweet spice and violets. A medium high acidity balances out the smooth tannin and full body. Yum!
90 pts. Great! Earthy, mushroom coffee dark chocolate and truffle. Still rich in its fruit and bit acidic chewy tannins; think it will soften a bit more in a few years, will improve bit clean
Inky purple Color, hints of vanilla and a bit of oak on the nose, vanilla oaky flavours with blackberries, medium minus acidity, good to drink with rich food. Medium finsjh
Nose is fantastic with cedar, sweet blueberry, and cassis. The wine is medium-plus bodied with decent acidity and a medium finish. Palate adds some black cherry and earth notes to the nose.

4.1/5. Sweet dark cherries, cassis, a bit tar, preserved fruit and almond skin finish 

Quite beautiful on the palate. Quite well integrated. Low acidity. Decant in glass.

Short TN

Withdrawn fruit, acceptable acidity, med+ astringence. Balance to the tannic side.
Medium length simple finish.
Tough call - 4/4.5 - makes me think 4.2 is a fair score on average. Earthy, bit of damp hedgerow, classic nose with a robust middle and a long finish. Enjoyable and smooth. Recommended.

Typical 12 for me is quite watery lighter and early matuer but not this one.

Green,coffee,black fruit with hint of woody and mineral tone.medium to full body.still tight.moderate tannic finish.
4.2. Wow, Cassis with tobacco, steely graphite structure, silky tannins, effusive on the nose, plums, red berries, tingling acidity. Very good now and will age another 10 years. Excellent stuff

Great wine well balanced, a good earthy tone to it. Smooth tannins and a great long finish. Would buy again!
Classic Pauillac.  Pencil shavings, green pepper, savoury and earth nose.  Medium body, tannic is smooth and well integrated, this wine is peaking right now.   93 points!
Great wine for a price, gentle tannins. Enjoyed the mildness of the üç∑ wine. Might be not powerful enough for people who likes complexity but great choice for a good dinner.
Top class pauillac almost never disappoints. Extremely smooth with such a jammy note of cherry and raspberry. It is perfect to drink right now but has a lot more years left in the tank.

Pracht van een Grand Cru uit Pauillac. Diep donkerrood, earthy and licht stroef/tannines. Rook, leer en aarde in de neus. Denk aan nat bos, berg bladeren. 
Rood fruit en hout bij aanvang, licht peperig in nadronk. Tintelend mondgevoel, geen zachte wijn. 
Wat een bijzondere wijn! 

(Met Marlies op landgoed Dennenholt, mei 2021)

A beautiful wine shared while kicking Kendall‚Äôs ass at backgammon.

Bright in color and lovely notes of everything I love; tobacco, dark fruit and oak.
Medium red color. Nose of black current, earthy and spicy note. Palate of nicely balanced tannins, leafy, sweetly black current. A very harmonious and well handled wine.

Surprisingly fruity on the nose with the floral and black fruit notes. Lovely leather and oak after a short decant. 

Solid 5th growth. Great value for what it is!
This was delicious. You could still taste the black fruits but a certain amount of finesse from the tank s made this perfectly balanced. Drinking well but more life yet

A great wine. Has everything that you would want in a old Bordeaux. Pencil shavings, cedar, menthol with an amazing palate with fresh fruit and tertiary notes. I don‚Äôt think this will get better but will stay at this stage for a long time.

A jewel from Bordeaux. Classic example of Pauillac. When I had my first sip, as much as the wine is old, it was clear to me that its tanins were very well. The wine xan definetely last many more yeats. For my taste it could wait for a couple of more years. Very elegant. Red fruit and plum.

Aromas of plum, cherry, strawberry, soft oak & licorice. Flavors include plum, cherry, oak, leather & minerality, with balanced acidity & tannins. Full body with a red fruit & smooth oak finish. Smooth texture & concentrated structure. A very intense & age worthy wine. Amazing wine.

A refined, delicious and elegant red claret that should be in every serious collectors cellar. A medium bodied wine with a colour edging on garnet. The wine is developing beautifully with plenty of blackberries, blackcurrants, cocoa, pencil lead, cedar wood and tobacco. The palate is super smooth with ripe, grippy tannins and a long finish. This wine drinks like a dream but requires decanting as it was quite closed for a good while. Enjoyed with beef Wellington.

4.25 ‚≠ê or 17/20.
Again unfortunately a historical tasting note from a tasting 12 years ago (in 2005)  when this 98-juice was just 7 years old. (A toddler or teenager?).
Again another typical Grd Out Lacoste with pronounced fruit, softness and fleshyness, round tannins, and quite earthy (terroir-y?) on the finish (in a good way). 
Massive fan of Grand-Puy-Lacostes!

1.1.2017 TastedBlind - Fortuitously replacement bottle

Our host thinking that the Gaja 1971 was flawed , opened this to make up for it .. lucky lucky stars

Immediate bellpepper and herbaceous nose followed by wet tobacco made me proclaimed it a St Julien fr the 80s .. resolved acid and tannins with hint of haw flakes on the finishing 

RP96 NM95 JR18.5

Amazing at 34 years and our generous host said 1982 was significant as it was his first year in university

@ WMK's Soft HouseWarming

Classic Pauillac , great vintage, which is crucial for chateau, that not always delivers. After 2 hours in decanter it continued evolution in the glass. Complex aromas of cassis, sour black cherries, tapenade, graphite, earth and leather. The palate was in perfect balance, elegant and sophisticated wine with mature tannins, long delicious finish and great potential.

Bright ruby red color.
On the nose , there is a wide range of aromas, predominantly blackcurrant, cedar, saddle leather with hints of mixed spices and cherry jam.
It is very generous on the palate , depth of flavor and evident breeding are combined with fine tannins and good fruit.
The wine shows great balance and style , it has considerable charm and elegance.
Very, very long, intense and classy!

One year later, still going strong. Nose evolved slowly from tobacco, leather & earthy notes to dark fruit - cassis, blackberry, blueberry. Still noticeable tannins & good acidity boxing well for significant longevity to come. Superb wine!

Initially I was sceptical about the year (Heatwave year) but as often, Chateau Grand Puy Lacoste didn't fail to deliver. Elegant well balanced, fruity... And a veeeery long finish. 
I think it is at its peak and can't aged more.

RP 91pts! Esse vinho s√≥ melhora com o tempo!

A youthful stunner with prime rib Christmas dinner and late contribution to Bordecember (cheers to DCLaxfan!).

Clear deep ruby color. Clean med intensity nose with notes of blackberry, plum, toasted bread, potting soil, forest floor and anise.

I've always been a burgundy man but this has got me thinking! Amazing wine with a fruity nose and in mouth you get a nice tertiary fruit note and then graphite (!?). The long and the short of it is I really enjoyed it

A delicious mature Bordeaux red with mellow tannin, dark fruits and notes of cinnamon and tobacco. It opened up beautifully in the glass and was a delight. Probably at its peak now. This was a worthy choice for my 500th review!

So, I host an April Fool's Day blind wine tasting for bottles under $20.  After the tasting, one of the judges pulled this out.  ü§Ø
Rich black fruit, forest floor, smoke, and here in 2022 its still super powerful!

Excellent wine. Decanted for c. 1 hr. Aromatic on the nose with blackberries and chocolate notes. Kinda knew I was in for a good one right from the get go. Dark ruby,  balanced on tasting, full bodied, high tannin... GPL really got its proportion of varietals right. Such a pleasure to drink... Must explore more Paulliac wines. Def WOTD

Wonderful display of aged Pauillac. Smokey ash tray smell, old leather arm chair and earthiness. The fruits have mellowed to be a blended medley. Medium tannin keeps it tight and a lengthy finish keeps on giving.

I got this wine as a gift for "Major" for about 75 Euros at an Auchan in Roissy, France. It normal goes for around $175-200.  I did my homework on Vivino before I bought...paid off. These folks weren't kidding. Chateau Grand-Puy-Lacoste/ Pauillac 2003 out of Bordeaux, France. Dark Ruby color- "Major" says smooth chocolate/plum syrup, smooth but rich. Excellent...I rate it a 4.7 out of 5. 13% Vol.

After earlier disappointments a reliable pauillac and my first dalliance with the cracking 05 vintage.
Deep ruby, aromas of blackcurrant red plum cranberry and dried fruit. On palette, blackberry vanilla with spice and tobacco. Dry, medium acidity, medium tannins, medium + body, finish long and satisfying. I would suggest this is at peak but will hold for 5 years at least. Delightful. 4.25+ happy Bordeaux Sunday!

Bordeaux 2016 tasting @ Vinoteket in Oslo. One of my absolute favorites of the evening.
2 years in oak.

Medium ruby color.
Med+ intensity on the nose.
Aromas of blackberries, blackcurrant, pencil lead, toast smoke & tobacco.
Dry, high acidity, full body, med+ alcohol, high tannin, pronounced flavor intensity, long lingering finish!
Inky concentration.
Can drink now, but will gets even better with age.

As we bid farewell to a Vivino Sydney Legend, The Barrel Hunter, you will be missed!

I‚Äôve had the opportunity to taste GPL a few times but only in its youth. This has fully developed and it‚Äôs so refined and delicate. It was hard guessing, thought maybe something from Margaux.

It was just lovely!

What a delight sharing this amazing bottle with my Sydney Vivino fellas! 

This is a very special wine for me - it was my engagement wine and it remains as delicious as I remember it from 2010.

The bouquet itself is worth the bottle with that magic nose that you only get from very old Pauillac! I love it - forest floor, mushrooms, dark fruits, smoke and leather. 

The palate is quite smooth yet still powerful at 32years of age. The acidity is still noticeable and this may just keep going. 

Catchin!!! 9/10
Leather and blackberry.   Black fruit and earthy.    Tobacco, cedar and cassis.   @Jay Leek and @Regina L I wish you were here to share this.   Elegant and graceful....powerful Pauillac.

Classic  paulliac nose. Decidedly  medium body. Very well integrated balanced throughout. Extremely long caressing finish. Opened two hours before drinking, drank over next two hours. Drinking perfectly now. Wouldn't wait.

35 years old. Immaculate cork. Excellent preservation direct from chateau to cellar. 
Bold wine, at peak. Earthy notes on the nose opened to black currant and berries and chocolate. 
This is a big boy to accompany big food, better on a cooler day. High complexity and keeps evolving after an hour. Drink it slowly. You still have 10 more years on this wine. Fantastic effort from Pauillac.

4.3 PNP. Cork in fine shape, Decanted off a decent amount of sediment. Cigar box, some cedar, a touch of earthy funk in a good way. Subtle black fruit, quite delicate up front, but reveals its layers as it coats the mouth. Tannins are still a bit course but not distracting, mouthwatering finish. Drinking beautifully right now.

A fine Cab driven Bordeaux beyond question.  Intense and robust, would benefit from 5 or so more years in cellar to reach its sublime peak and mellow the strong tannins.  A bit overly Earthy in 2022, but a brilliant wine.

Old wine with smooth cheese, pencil shavings, mushroom, cedar leather, yeast , oak, vanilla and plum nose. The palate is earthy, blackcurrant, plum and a bit of chocolate hint. Again, old aged wine so has this ‚ÄúI am old‚Äù feature with the smell and taste. Overall still a great wine and great experience !

Purpur-rubinrote Farbe, hohe Intensit√§t in der Nase marmeladigen Duft nach Johannisbeeren und Kirsche, aber auch grasig, holzig und blumig. Viel Tannine, mittelm√§ssig S√§ure und K√∂rper, mittlerer Abgang, toll, gute Balance.

Having another bottle of the ‚Äò82. All the bottles in this case have soiled labels due to one breaking in storage earlier in this life. This bottle lost its label altogether, but thankfully there is absolutely nothing wrong with the wine. 

Sous-bois and liquorice, still retaining some black fruit and crushed rock. Despite its age the wine is still fresh and powerful and I‚Äôd say it‚Äôll last another 20+ years. Decant essential here!

Bordeaux tasting #12:
The second last wine of the night was this 5th growth chateau. Dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon (75+%) this was for me the wine of the night. (Don‚Äôt ask me why üòÇ). 
There are 12,000 cases produced on average per year. Stainless steel fermented followed by barrel maturation (50% new).

Earthy, leather, very velvety mouthfeel. Very strong on the tannin structure so looking forward to tasting in a few years time.

Clean clear wine with a medium intense core of deep ruby with a brick red tinge. Medium+ viscosity. Nose of black fruit, licquorice and aged leather. The wine is dry with medium acidity and medium tannins. Excellent balance. Nice length, medium+ and a robust structure. Smooth finish, great wine.

Mint and cinnamon nose. Nice white spice. Palate has a lot of herbaceous notes with lovely red berry and plum on back palate. Lots of spice with some cherry. Even though very young, has some tertiary development with a touch of forest floor on finish. Tannins surprisingly elegant for such a young Pauillac.

Medium / Deep Ruby. Pronounced aromas of black currant, red currant, red plum, red cherry, floral notes (violet) and milk chocolate. Medium + acidity and noticable tannins. Long aftertaste. Delicious wine!

Tinto,vermelho ruby,  limpido brilhante e transparente. Bouquet pronunciado de frutas negras, caf√©. This is a monster, but the kind of monster you want to take home and safeguard for a decade. At first the fruit invites you in, teases with herbs and iron-y earth, but then crushes with a tannic grip. So good.

This is a Classic Pauillac, tannic and full bodied.
Blend of 78% CS and 22% Merlot is aged for 16 months in French oak with 13% abv.
Dark red color, aromas of raspberries, cinnamon, tobacco and espresso. On palate is structured and elegant with velvety tannins and flavors of chocolate, vanilla and toffee. Deep and persistent finish.
RP95, ST93.

TASTED EN PRIMEUR.
Still in the hands of the Borie family, with patriarch, Xavier, in 2018 making his 40th vintage here - and what a year! A superb, elegance supplied by 78% Cabernet Sauvignon, with 22% Merlot adding a lovely round fruit. Deep colour, with a perfect balance of tannins and fruit throughout.

**Saturday Older Wines Day**
Very nicely developed wine, very structured, very pure and focussed. Meaty, spicy, complex, very elegant. Great length, the details are in the finish here.
Medium+ intense aromas of blackberry, blackcurrant, red plum, leather, cedar, toast, bell pepper, roast beef, tobacco, espresso, forest floor, bay leaf, liquorice wood.
Dry wine, medium+ acidity, medium+ and fine-grained tannins, medium body, pronounced flavour intensity, long finish.
Left bank 1990 tasting @ Le Vineur

A complex but pure nose: red fruit, blue fruit and black fruit all in harmony. Palate is just as generous, with ripe tannins and a silky mouthfeel. Then layers of spice, espresso and tobacco and an indulgently long finish.

My holiday bottle! ü•Ç Bought it at Idealwine auction. I prefer Right Bank, but this Left Bank is very good. Cool evolution with changing notes of strawberry in vanilla cream, cassis, cherry juice, violet, tobacco, chocolate, elegant cedar, underbrush. Palate reflects nose with  balanced acidity and smooth tannins, red fruit and black fruit, chocolate, forest floor and cedar, pleasant aftertaste of chocolate, underbrush and fruits. My expectations were a bit higher, but still an excellent wine. 4.2-4.3üåü

A superb smooth red. One of the lowest tannins wine I have tasted. Low acidity as well, mushroom, cassis, chocolate, tobacco and light vanilla and mint touch to it. As we decant it properly, there‚Äôs more complexity to it. This is a good year to drink it. Can‚Äôt imagine how good it will be if we age it for a few more years. I preferred it decanted at around 30-45 mins.

This is really starting to show well with its cigar box, cedar, cassis, earth, tobacco and wet earth charms. Concentrated, full bodied and structured for further aging, you can pull a cork now, if you give it an hour or two of air, else let it rest another 5 years.

Mid garnet, brick edge. Cedar, smoke, cassis, dark plum, violet, straw, interesting noise that opens well. Palate is elegant, medium body, tannin still has grip, mushroom, forest floor, good ripe red and dark fruits, black currant, licorice, plum, full. A little short. Good 03 without the overripeness of some. 17.75/20. 92/100. #frenchwine #riedel #bordeaux #pauillac #winetasting #grandpuylacoste

4.5 A perfect Pauillac.  My third bottle of this perfectly aged BDX.  My favorite BDX for <$150.  Grand-Puy Lacoste is one of the oldest properties in the Medoc, next to Pontet Canet and Lynch Bages.  38 yo vines.  Run by the Borie family since 1979.  A great nose of cassis, cilantro, brown sugar, graphite, nutmeg, walnut.  Wonderfully subtle complex nose.  Great fresh acidity and light tannins.  Perfect balance.

Two years since I tried this 1983 Ch√¢teau Grand-Puy-Lacoste and this bottle was slightly better. Just look at the perfectly intact cork, impressive after 38 years. Textbook nose of black currant, herbs, leather, cedar wood. Unreal smooth on palate everything super balanced so upgraded last rating to 4.4‚≠êÔ∏è

Ruby-colored, with bricking at the edges... This must be an aged wine. The nose kept giving - tea-leaves, orange-peel, flowers, forest-floor, a bit of cigar, ink. Wow! Smooth and elegant on the palate, with some fruits and tannins still intact. My first '61 GPL and a great experience.

Excellent Pauillac again from Lacoste. Young but with deep ripe fruit and good concentration and balance. Although undeniably inferior this was not completely blown away by the Lafite which is surely testament to its quality. Great value at ¬£69 for a high class wine. 4.3/5.

Superbe, ouvert 2 heures avant d√©gustation, pass√© en carafe d√©licatement. Du premier au dernier verre, le vin √©volue, fruits murs, tabac, des tanins souples et une rondeur comme on a envie d'en boire sans fin ! Du plaisir quoi.

93. Mature aromas of blackcurrant, plum, tobacco, leather. Wine is balanced with structured tannins. Taste of red fruits, tobacco, earth. Finish is long. Very good, still will benefit from some 5 years in cellar. To drink now needs decanting for 2-3 hours.

Ruby with brick orange rim.Nose: black fruits,dark chocolate,liquorice accents,classic aged Bordeaux mustiness.Palate: blackberry,blackcurrant,hint of cranberry,earth,forest floor,graphite and smoke. Medium bodied,long finish. Delicious treat from a great host. Nov 15

Classical, bit rustic Bordeaux. In appearance relatively young. Dark in the glass with only a touch of brown. Nice nose. Strong blackcurrant fruit. Very long finish. Very nice, will probably stayblike this for many, many more years.

This was drunk from the bottle. No need to decant. The wine was open from the getgo..classic Pauillac nose with plenty barnyard.  Over the next couple of hours it developed and gentle tannins evolved.  Amazing fifth growth can compete with the big boys on this showing...

Overall 4.7 @ Praelum: Appearance is clear deep garnet. Smell is pronounced with aromas of dark fruit, oak and herbaceous. Taste is dry, medium acidity, medium tannins and full bodied with long finish.

Interesting side by side drinking Grand Puy Lacoste 1995 with Pichon Baron 1995. GPL started off much more ready to drink with initial permeating barnyard nose, which even out over the night to become chassis then menthol mint and cedary, what an evolution. Overall nicely balanced and drinking superbly.

Classic Pauillac: austere, concentrated and powerful with deep earthy notes of tobacco, mushroom and black berries; some dark chocolate too.  A relatively big wine with nice volume and rich palate and well integrated tannins.  It ends on a remarkable long savoury finish. Plenty of life ahead, this is just entering its prime window
 
Thank you Jammy Wine for sharing this over a fun evening with Tom and Carlo.

My wine of the night with competition from the Pichon 2003.

Amazing fruit core and concentration. Earthy, nutty, with lots of dark fruits. A really deep and savoury wine with marked acidity and tannins. This has some life ahead of it.

Thank you Jammy Wine for sharing.

If the Les Forts de Latour '96 is the mood of a vibrant, summer New Orleans jazz scene, this wine is the dark and smoke-filled Chicago basement jazz lounge.

Nose is loaded with cassis, black currants, blackberry, spicy cigar tobacco like a Montecristo No. 2, whispers of cedar, & a dominant graphitic pencil lead up front that lingers. As it opens roasted red pepper, cacao, new saddle leather, & some savouriness lifts through. 
The dense texture of the wine has an irresistible, voluptuous mouthfeel.

Drank from a paper cup by the side of the South Branch of the Moose River with some NY strip steak grilled by the fire.  I just enjoyed the mature claret without getting too intellectual about it. I wish I had a case left.

96 Bordeaux tasting 7/8

This was actually a close second for me on the night and did come second overall. 

It doesnt look or smell that evolved, fruit still kind of dominates with a very powerful nose.

On the palate the fruit is there in spades compared to the other wines, it really didnt seem that old to me. Plenty of life here. 

Tannin at the front of the mouth feeling less integrated but slightly more wild. 

Really enjoyed this but it was just pipped by the Latour.

4.5*

Intense nose with lots of barnyard initially. Divisive in our tasting. Mellowed to a rich jammier aromas with lots of tertiary interest. Nose and taste perfectly aligned. Rich, deep and very long finish. More like HB 00 and Bat08 than others in the tasting but more intense/interesting. Fruitier/easier than HB 89 (latter more distinctive).

Tasted at Christmas 2018. This is an incredible example of how time pays. The nose shows evolution where the fruit has  softened and the oak has disappeared into the background. On the palate, soft, light, still shows some freshness! A delightful tasting where the sum of parts gives something so much more than the individual elements.

All rounded high quality producer!! Probably at its best year now for this vintage. Nose is a m+ with ripe berry fruits like blueberry, blackberry, vanilla, leather, baking spices, hint of minerals. And it‚Äôs such a show in the mouse. With just 13%, it gives you a kick right away with its structure hitting every palate. M+ acidity, juicy fruits with nice integrated wood. The chewy tannin is such a treat. And above all, the finish is endless!! Tho it‚Äôs a balanced style to me unlike other Pauillac wines.

As good as the '85‚Äîactually, even better. Sweet silky tannins, earth, coffee and chocolate with subtle residual fruit, and very solid backbone. Finish lasts forever. Nose of spice and cloves. Awesome.

I've tried this many times and am a big fan.

Still dark and impenetrable with light on the edges. Classic Bordeaux velvety, Animaly, minerally nose, leather, licorice, tobacco. Well balanced palate, tannins a touch too delicate, decent finish not too powerful.

8.5-9 (Nov11)

After giving up on the Wendouree, I ordered this in a state of drunken enthusiasm. It‚Äôs brilliant, even allowing for the effects of alcohol on my judgement.  It‚Äôs the vintage after the vintage of the century, and so it‚Äôs a bit of a hidden secret. This has all the poise you want from a great claret, it‚Äôs in its drinking window, has the lead and cassis you with some secondary aromatics on the nose. At its peak and I‚Äôm looking forward to drinking the rest tonight.

Still ruby color but starting to fade a bit. Typical grand puy Lacoste. Animal aromas, but more pleasant on the nose than the 08. Dark fruits, tobacco and leather. Drinks very well now, but could easily last a few more years. Long finish

Excellent wine with ruby red colour. 
Cabernet Sauvignon is 75%, Merlot 25%.
Complex nose develops after time with black currant, forest fruits, wood, vanilla, some earthy notes and leaves.
Similar on the palate with full body, medium acid, soft and elegant, velvety tannins, and long pleasent finish. Delicious wine.

Very good.  Had it with steak, mushrooms, and Royal Red shrimp that taste like lobster.  Not sure it was the right fit given other reviews.  I was not blown away by this wine.  Had some complexity, and was strong enough to stand on it own against this meal.  Still great!

Monumental wine. There‚Äôs an immense power to this coupled with some tertiary Bordeaux characteristics of cigar ash and tobacco. Ripe fruit for its time, some savouriness to the wine that I liked. I do love old school Bordeaux that have a certain rusticity and marginal ripeness character. They don‚Äôt quite make wines like this anymore.

Off the charts delicious. An absolutely classic, full left bank Bordeaux with a very strong and developed nose at this point consisting of cedar and cigar box. Drinking incredibly well right now. Can't go wrong.

Smooth, complex, refined, gorgeous, enticing, lavishly alluring, compellingly pleasing and fulfilling - some very properly and inherently unique adjectives to describe how well this wine behaved with me and an appetizer of foie gras & a lamb dinner. Out of this world! A kaleidoscope of exploding flavors superbly matched. Viol√†!!

Medium ruby in color with medium intensity nose. Cherry, leather, raspberry. Dry, high acidity, medium tannins, medium body, medium alcohol and medium flavor intensity. Cherry and more cherry. Medium finish. Very good quality of wine. 3.8 stars

As with all vintage wines, it plays out over the hours. Starts with pencil and cigar nose, and then evolves into fruit and chocolate. Colour looks so young throughout! Pleasantly surprised how well this drinks now üôè

Expressive earthy aroma with mushroom and pencil shaving notes and prune and plum undertones. Ruby red color, full body with mellow and elegant tannin. Mushroom, cedar and cassis notes on the palate with refined finishing of dark fruits

My old review below but my palate has changed: great complex wine.. Dried leaves and tobacco smooth at the start, dark fruit hits you at the middle and then the caramel at lingering finish.  You HAVE to decant and let breath for at least 45 min to let things smooth out. Flinty with strong granite and tobacco flavors , paired best with food to

This wine is lovely. Expressive on the nose. Dried plums and cherries. Cigarbox. Vanilla. Very nice balance and structure on the palate. Resolved tannins. Good level of fruit. Peaking right now. Give it about 15 minutes to open in the glass and then watch it evolve over the next couple of hours.

En nariz fruta negra madura, un toque de regaliz y an√≠s que le da un perfil especiado. En boca hay fruta pero resulta bastante t√°nico y denso. Acidez correcta termina de balancear este vino. No es la mejor a√±ada pero es un buen vino.

2003 with 2hr decant - still very youthful with deep colour and intense, almost sweet fruit on the nose. A hot vintage comes through with rich cassis and kirsch blended with mocha and licorice oak. (Potential 4.5 - this wine is still a baby) After a day of being open, the nose leads off with black fruit, cassis, blackberry, gingerbread, cloves, smoke, damp earth, violet. 3rd bottle, 10 years old! Dark red ruby, nose is filled with black fruits, black currants, black berries, spices and tobacco leaf. On the palate is medium -full bodied, vibrant yet juicy mouthfeel and finely grained tannin with spices undertone lingering along with its moderate long finish.

This one will probably become a winner but it seems to close down at the moment... Nose is currently a bit muted but one can identify lots of wonderful notes, in particular after long breathing. Cassis, cigar box, graphite, warm wood. The taste is quite full, tannins still young. Finish is long and promising. Great potential. Will wait for the next bottle some time...

GPL 2011 for my 3rd time and I still did not get the Pauillac signature notes, however @[1|24439245|Joe Yee Wong] did.. Well done!

A lighter, fresher Pauillac style, cassis finish and smooth tannins.

Being adjacent to Pontet Canet and Lynch Bages, GPL's terroir is equally impressive. Memories of our left bank road trip in Mar 2022.

Thanks to @[1|1258030|SKT] for joining us in our banter and wine tasting, its amazing that you were 4 of 4 üí° on the bottles we brought. Night out at Fire Grill in TTDI üá≤üáæ

Deep ruby.  Subtle and subdued, mainly black fruits dominated by plum.  A bit close, but the lack of fresh fruit seems to suggest that this wine is not one for keeping.  Will breathing it longer open up the aroma and fruitiness?  I didn‚Äôt get to find out.  Medium acidity, tannin and body, decent aftertaste of cooked black fruit flavours, but rather flat towards the end.  1 March 2018.

Tasting 8 from a Bordeaux 2011 tasting.  I have little or no experience with these, especially babies like these. So my notes and ratings are based on a drink now basis.
Almost noseless, hint of blackberries, stemmy and bitter. (3.5)

Med to med+ Ruby color. It's been opened for almost 2hr. volatile blackberry, oaky on the nose. Overall not intense as I expected from 09 vintage. On the palate, tobacco, dark chocolate, oaky, ripe dark fruits. Good Length of aftertaste. Not much characteristic on its own but it's a balanced wine.     I will say you can drink it now, and also see its development over the year. But I won't consider it as a long aging wine.

Still young despite 12 years of bottle age. Black currant on the nose. Black fruit, graphite, cassis and hints of tobacco. Plenty of structure but sweet tannins. Lovely now and will be even more exquisite in another 5 years.

Tried this in 2017 and beginning 2019.  The wine has aged a bit.  Very dark plum in color.  Aromas of dark fruits, spice and tobacco.  Dry and more than medium tannins.  Toffee, pencil shavings and tobacco notes.  Good legs.  Developing a good aftertaste.

3.5* is not indicative of its potential. Garnet in the glass, but bursting with dark fruit out of the bottle. A lot of graphite, pencil shavings, pepper, and cigar box. Medium high tannins, acid and body. Given time, vanilla and oak came through over the fruit. Slightly confusing, but probably a little early in its development; again surprising for a 11.

My 53rd bottle of 2021
My experiment on keeping,
Resulted? All emptied!! ü§£

I've packed GPL in tubes to test how long they survive, I first opened a tube just to try, but ended up with drank all instead! üòÇ

üç∑: Aromas of ripe black fruits, plum, cinnamon, licorice, leather, vanilla, oak, with spice. Silky and elegant rather than powerful, complex and balance, with moderate aftertaste.

üéº: Hank Mobley "Remember" paired well with this wine, but I too prefer Philly Joe Jones drum solo in Workout a lot. üòÅ

Delicious Pauillac comprising 79/21 Cab Sauv/Merlot 5th Growth Pauillac & aged 16-18m in 75% new oak.

Med ruby. Vibrant blackcurrant, blackberry, black cherry & cream. Delicious integration of oak spice w. nutmeg & vanilla. Complex, sophisticated & rich w. pronounced aroma intensity. Youthful.

Dry. Fantastic elegance & balance w. rich blackcurrant, black cherry & blueberry. Cedar, vanilla, toasty spice & dried fruitcake. High fine tannins, high acid, warming m+ alc & a long slick finish. Very good all round.

Have had the 2008 4 years ago and seemingly was averagely impressed.  This however I really liked. It breathed for about 45mins which probably help.  Excellent, yes rounded but full.  Lots of rich cocoa back of the mouth.

This 2004 Puy Lacoste still goes a long way.

Completely closed for the first hour and starts to smoothen and mellow after six hours open cork.

Cedar, smoky, spices, black fruits and cassis on the nose and go through one the palate. Medium plus for every aspect.

A classic and worth waiting Puy Lacoste.

Great Pauillac Cabernet carrying lots of wisdom and great acidity at equal parts. It should have been oxygenated before serving. Some aromas of reduction then gone. On the veggy side of things.

Aromas fresh red forest fruit. Tomato plant leaves. Eucaliptus. Exotic spices, clove In mouth, very agile, horizontal with little verticality. Not totally balanced with some 'ancienity' hints.

Top tier pauillac - not from the grandest years but still a very good wine and great price / value
Brilliantly structured with softened tannins,m accompanied by notes of coffee , red fruits, Cassis and slight aroma of chestnuts maybe .
Opened nicely after a short decanting of 30 mins. Gave very good pleasure during a nice dinner

Deep dark colour. Very elegant and refined. A lot of ripe blackcurrant on the palate, together with some ash and vanilla.
Vivino says 100% cab, but its actually a blend of cab Sauvignon, merlot and cab franc ( 75%,20%,5%)
Very well balanced. Not as complex as anticipated.
Drinks well now. About 700NOK. 
4,2‚≠ê

Caraffes for an hour and half, Deep red with orange halo, nose on red and black fruits, fairly smooth tanins, a bit short in mouth. Had better GLP before (2005), maybe not optimal storage (Dubai duty free Le Clos....).

Cassis at first and quite earthy and balanced itself as it decants and opens up with the tobacco coming in. Lovely Pauillac that you enjoy sipping with a bit of cheese or on its own. Robe is delightful.

Incredible flowery on the nose. Drunk it after another Pauillac (Comtesse from Pichon) of the same vintage which was more smooth. This Puy Lacoste still has strong tannins. Will be a topper in a few years. Another 4.2 this evening and again very close to a 4.5.

Mmmm. This came from the depths of my wine fridge. How did it get there? Did I buy it? Most pressingly, how do I replace it? Great structure, nice bitey tannins, smooth finish, creamy fruit (yes creamy ‚Äî fight me!) and all behind a luscious purple-red colour and berry-fronted nose. Zut, alors, j‚Äôai besoin de plus.

Rich wine with green leaves, black currant aromas. More structure than GP Ducasse, high tannins and wood well integrated.red and dark fruits dominate palate. Long length finishing with vanilla oak and mocca.
@ Zurich UGCB Tasting

A fantastic Pauillac. Very well integrated tannins, acidity and fruits. Medium acidity with subtle minerality. Hints of leather and pebble. After 6 hours decanting the finish had a definate grapefruit liquorice flavour.

Superbly smooth and even tempered Pauillac - leather cedar and blackcurrant flavours amidst well balanced tannins which are softening with age. Very drinkable but will go a number of years more with ease.

I‚Äôve not had too many 2008s from Pauillac, but this GPL is in a great spot. The primary fruit is still evident, but the tertiary is also starting to poke through. Cassis, graphite, cedar and King Edward cigars. The palate is still grippy and alive, but the mouthfeel is smooth, and the finish is fairly lingering. Not the most intense Pauillac, but drinking well, and possibly better than anticipated. 4‚≠êÔ∏è+

A very solid and decent Bordeaux left bank with the typical notes of pencil shavings, cassis, and leather. Intense notes supported by high acidity and fine tannins. Finish is long with dominant fruity and mineral notes.
The wine is deep garnet with med+ intensity of strawberry, blackberry, black currant, plum, oak, smoke, cedar, mint, leather, and wet stone.
On the palate, the wine is dry, with med+ acidity, ripe fine high tannins, med alc, med+ body, med+ intensity, and med+finish.
Wine is outstanding

Red capsicum, black plum, salami and violets on the nose. The palate is dry, with high tannins and medium plus acidity. Rounded palate with mulberry, dark plum, licorice, cedar and toast on the nose. Has all primary, secondary and tertiary aromas.

Backlog catch up.
Ruby with lots of bricking.  Nose of tertiary- earth, bramble, underbrush, vegetal, clay.  Palate of tart cherry, woodsiness, dry earth.  Fine tannins.  Decent acidity.  Drinkable now but could handle another 2 or so years.  Medium plus length.  Finish of leather and spice.

Deep Dark fully ripe black cherry colour in the glass.
Floral nose with eucalyptus and Autumn leaf..hint of sweet pie crust...
Smooth full mouth feel all blackcurrant and any hint of jam is cassis...for me it pretty much ends there with a gentle lapping of tart cherry some charred pepper perhaps and a fairly long finish of white pepper..or perhaps jalapeno.
Glad i found it for 45$...would have been disappointed at 60$..
Probably worth getting a case for tomorrows.

üëÅBrilliant garnet, brownish rim
üëÉClassic Bordeaux nose with cassis, blackberries, red berry mix, more leather than cigar box 
üëÖPerfect extremely fruity: blackberry, a little plum, red berries, smoothest cigar box. Medium acidity. Velvety tannins. Cherry aftertaste, a hint of currant. Medium- long fruity finish. Extremely harmonious slightly lacking depth. Cork was slightly cracked so might be biased. 

Delightful classic.

Deep garnet-purple in glass, almost no light goes through.  On the nose: earthy notes, mushroom, old leather.  In the mouth: full bodied, medium tannins, medium low alcohol, medium acidity that is actually felt much later after the sip.  On the palate: loads of earthy notes, forest floor, mushroom.  Vanilla is there but very subtle.  The crescendo is very pronounced with bittersweet black fruit.  The finish is long with carried over black fruit bitterness.  Definitely to be consumed with food.

Med Ruby color. Med+ nose intensity. Colpex aromas of Green pepper, black currant, black currant bud, Oak; toast. Palate is dry, med+ acid and med+ lasting tannins. Fullbody. med alcohol. Flavours adds leather and tobacco in addition to nose aromas. Pronounced flavourintensity amd long finish. Drink now, but potential for ageing.

13,5 % ; quite deep ruby almost inky colour.
Cabernet on the nose but a bit closed in though.
Creamy, velvet, almost fat, quite "thick" but elegant and tender on the palate. Tannins are as smooth as you can get. Nice balance, nice roundness also. 
No bitterness, drinks easily  (or almost so).
I like this wine. Definitely better than Ch d'Armailhac I had recently and a bit more concentrated than Ch Batailley. 4.2 / 5 for me

Ripe fruit, violets, pencil shavings and capsule. On the palate fruit, cedar and cocoa. The meaty tannine structure was clearly Bordeaux typed and because of the capsule flavor, this had to be Pauillac. Nice without a doubt.

92/100
Deep crimson red with clearing rim, showing very slight sign of age.
Nose: pencil lead, wet pebble, rock salt, spicy herb, leather, soil, bell pepper, cedar, subtle plum and oak. 
Palate: Med-full body. mostly black fruit, cassis and black cherry. Smooth yet still fresh grippy tannin. Relatively high acidity.

It is a perfect Bordeaux with heaps of black fruit on the nose with hints of leather and dark chocolate. Complex and silky on the palate even with this young age. Strong mid palate and long smooth finish. Good value considering it's exceptional quality.

A rich indulgence for sure. Dark colour on the cork is already starting to give away the intense leather and chocolate notes that characterise this great Bordeaux. An almost pepper and blackberry taste that is smooth from start to finish. Amazing wine!

Deep ruby 
Strong nose of black fruit - blackberries; black cherry; cassis; plum; good oaky nose of toast; almond; nutmeg; hint of leather; developing

Very good Bordeaux blend; well balanced; very good structure and complexity; prime to drink now.

This CS dominated blend (76/24 merlot) had a nose of bell peppers and flowers. Medium+ bodied, dry, some acidity greatly balanced with firm tannins needing some more aging. But really pretty wine. Nice finish of prunes and black cherries.

What a joy, even now, despite the youth of this wine! However, it is definitely worth to be patient for another five years (at least). Then, the oak will be even better integrated.
What a shame it was to open this. Way to young, I should have waited at least 10 years to open it. It was quite good, all things considered.

Wow, I think is the best Bordeaux I have tasted. Extremely complex dark fruits, tobacco, super nice soft tannins. It keep changing for an hour. Certainly to keep in the cellar for an easy 5-10 years.

Medium garnet color. Great nose with soft black fruit, leather and flowers (frangipani?). Maybe something slightly gamey underneath. Third time having this wine. Still love it. Great red fruit, soft tannins and that classic french funk forest floor nose. Had it in a side by side tasting with 1996 Peter Michael Les Pavots. Desperate to try this wine since i bought en primeur. Problem with Bordeaux for me is always: if not at the right time at the right temperature, you gonna be disappointed and waste a lot of money. This opened up after about 40 min or so to reveal some lovely red, plummy fruit and blackcurrants on the palate, firm, structured tannins, and a lingering, softer finish that lasted a good while. Impressive stuff and drinking well now.

Could have been a ‚Äò4‚Äô if we‚Äôd decanted for a while;  almost a steel-aged initial taste, which broadened into a deeper cedar, woodsy, earthy chocolate mouth with medium fruit after; silky smooth with our filet, yet could have used more depth via decanting (W - 12/26/18).

ruby red in colour with pear, goji berries and caramel on the nose. medium bodied claret with raspberry, manuka flowers, and vanilla pod on the palate. silky smooth finish with wonderful harmonisation of acidity, volume and chalkiness. 2008 vintage simply magnificent

Deep purple-ruby. Highly aromatic nose offers scents of smoky blackberry, red cherry, violet, cocoa and spicy oak. Juicy, spicy and rather deep for the vintage, with nicely concentrated sour cherry and bright blackcurrant lifted by a floral element.

Was served too cold at the beginning which made the wine a little bit dull due to the massive amount of wood aroma. After warming up the wood became a little bit more subtle but still too much present. It also had black cherries, red pepper, sigar box, toast. Taste also has lots of toast and black cherry accompanied by some chocolate. Expected longer finish. In my opinion rather medium.

Chateau Grand Puy-Lacoste 2008 
Fine bouquet of toasty cassis, underpinning a tannic core, with nuances of spicy peppers lingering on the bouquet. Supple texture on the entry, tightly knitted palate of spicy green fruits, leaving a lingering grippy note on the finish.

Nose: burst of fresh fruits. Lacks tannin, smells like strawberry and blackberry. Not sophisticated. 

Palate: more tannic than expected. Alcohol. Almost all black fruit. Does have medium long finish that lasts. Is way too young still. Could use another 10 years. Not too jammy but the tannins do coat mouth. Bit of a sour finish. 3.7
Ripe and ready to drink. With limited airing opened up nicely. Every last drop enjoyed.
Bold wine with deep color , cassis with a little spice, almost has structure of a cabernet.
Lots of berry, balanced and still can hold for another 5 years
