Dark red color.  
Decanted for two hours.  
A delicate smell of blackcurrant, blueberries, licorice, leather, forest floor and old cellar.  

A very pleasant taste of dark berries, blackcurrants, blackberries and chocolate. Well-balanced fruitiness with soft round tannins. Long, good aftertaste. The wine is approaching the development peak, but still has some power and years left. Had the wine with roast of lamb and it was a match made in heaven. Too bad it was the last 2008 bott

Not sure about this - think it needs more years but not convinced the fruits will last. Seems young and harsh right now (drinking a 2011 in 2020). The nose is full and rich, blackberries and pencil lead, but there‚Äôs just too much acid and raw tannins on the palate. Not rounded out; although the tannins will get silky over time, between a 2 - 5 hours decant the fruit died a lot on the palate, so not sure of its longevity. The same producer‚Äôs Saint Guirons 2013 drinks better now at less than half the price.

Oh yeah...this is wine.  I was trying to watch Stranger Things while drinking this with my wife...but the smooth tannins, easy drinking, balanced fruit and long finish kept distracting me.  Have the 2010 as well...can‚Äôt wait to compare.

Dark black red; nail polish and leathery pencil lead; medium heavy lead shavings and black currant lasting finish 13.5%, evolves nicely after a bit of aeration and warming, quality claret perfect with peppery steak

In isolation it is not a bad wine. But in the context of price you can do much better. The aromatic nose promises what the palette doesn‚Äôt deliver. Yes there is cedar and vanilla and almond but this almost certainly the oak barrel rather than the grape. 2013 was a reputedly a wet year and this is reflected in the 1 dimensional flavour. No explosion of fruit. No lasting finish. I still have the rest of the case but I would love to try the 2016 instead. 

Update: 2nd bottle. Still very underwhelming.

80% Cabernet, 20% Merlot. Ageing 16m in 45% new oak barrel.
Deep ruby, balanced black fruits, sweet spices, savoury, meaty, vanilla and coconut aromas.
Muscular and smooth tannins, good structured, with a medium mouthfeel. Elegant on palate, expanding with violet, plum, black cherry, liquorice, cinnamon, chocolate flavours, and a sweet fruity finish.

3.4„Äú3.3. BYO to a small but authentic Japanese restaurant served course dishes of unfrozen natural blue fin tuna from Toi, Hokkaido delivered by Yamayuki. Deep garnet color, classic Rive Gauche with aroma of cassis.

Even though I did not know 2013 was one of the most difficult vintages for Bordeaux, I could easily be aware that the chateau had struggled how they achieved their best possible quality for the vintage.
To be honest, weak structure, in 2019 this one was enough ready to drink and indicated that it might be very difficult to be maintaining its top quality for another 5 years. Silky but not complicated tannin it had. Aroma was not strong... Having said so, still this one proved why this is graded in 5th.

Basic too young Pauillac off vintage 5 growth red. Dark berries, liguorice, slighly dark chocolate and balsamico on shy nose. Too acid and grippy tannins with blackberries on thin palate.  Basic finish. A bit one dimensional and thin texture. Lacks fruityness too. Disappointment for me.  Didnt benefit either 2-3 hours decanding. Hope it  benefits longer cellaring but I cant believe that it would reach even four stars at any circumstances. Nearer three than four stars now. Poor QPR.

Heard ‚Äò13 was a bit of a naff vintage yet intriguing to try this from an esteemed producer.
Early maturity to it, drinking well now probably for a couple more years. Not much body and actually quite easy going.

Delicious wine for the long weekend. Loving the fruit forward aromas of black cherries of this Pauillac. Sweet creme de cassis, vanillin spice, with a touch of red floral notes. Enjoyable on the palate with a nutty and dark fruit finish. 

4.2/5
Fruity dry wine with excellent flavor and finish.  A little high in tannins but overall a nice wine.
This is going down well. Soft tannins, oak, vanilla, earthy with dark red fruits & a lingering dry finish
I tasted it after too long inventory in the house. But I know this is very good wine. I will taste with fresh one later.

Beautiful wine, the colors, the aromas... every step of the tasting was exquisitely wonderful! Probably the best aged Bordeaux I‚Äôve ever had. Changing nose and mouth with strong notes of  tobacco, cedar, leather, oak, blackcurrant and plum. 

I couldn‚Äôt help but notice its intense red, full bodied, sticky tannins and an amazing and long lasting finish. It just went way past any expectations I had about wines. 

I‚Äôd give it a five star rating but I think I have a lot more to explore before rating that high.

Un nez de baies noires, de cuir et tabac, peu de bois. Une robe fort fonc√©e. Une bouche reconnaissable des grands bordeaux, un tourbillon de fruits noir prend toute l'amplitude du palais, des tannins cisel√©s et encore un peu jeunes mais d√©j√† bien int√©gr√©s viennet compl√©ter la mati√®re pour une bouche volumineuse, le tout dans une belle rondeur, le cuir et le tabac et la touche de bois persistent sur la longueur et le retro-nasal. Even for this ok vintage still a very good wine . A touch of greenery and tobacco smoke driven by a cassis and dried fruit core . This wine had finesse and depth and still  lively after 15 years .

This was exquisite, it is robust, full bodied and definitely benefitted fro decanting an hour or so before drinking. We had a liver pate starter and venison main course, unfortunately I have no idea how it would be with the venison, bottle finished at end of starter! I have collected this wine for a number of years now, since 1999! My plan was to have a case of each year up to 2019, then sell it as a collection, so with 3 years to go, I fear that the plan will change! It‚Äôs too damn good to sell!!

At the UGCB 2017 tasting in Chicago Jan 22nd 2020. A 5th Growth Grand Cru from Pauillac

Higher tannins than many of the other Pauillac wines tasted. Dark Fruits and oak. A nice medium-long dry finish.¬† Vintage 2017. Varietal: 80% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot.

Milestone moment in my life. Celebrating the 18th birthday of my daughter at Wilhelminapark restaurant in Utrecht (where she was born). As matching bottle this beauty of her birth year. Specially saved for the moment. 4.5* bottle at a 5* occasion. 

Great velvety and perfumed nose after couple of hours aeration of cherry, red berry and sweet tobacco. Delicious palate of cherry, plum, smoky tones, sweet paprika, bergamot, tobacco, licorice, laurel, splendid minerality and a fantastic long warm spicy finish.

Medium garnet red and clear in the glass. Velvety, bramble blackberry on the nose which halfway through the bottle is changing to Graphite and tobacco. Very dry on the palette, good acidity, and very approachable. Pairs very well with smoked Guinea fowl and chanterelle which takes advantage of the great terroir and accentuates chalky, smoke of the wine. For me, a special occasion wine that I wish could be a dialy drinker.
Super vin!!!! Un must

This 2005 vintage was my second favorite wine of the lineup tonight. Licorice and strawberry notes dominant. A textbook bold Pauillac, but opened up nicely over slow sipping this one. I could see massive aging potential here.

13072022 - blind tasting dinner with @[1|24439245|Joe Yee Wong] & new vinos from SG & Penang. Bottle from bro CY and what a reveal! My 1st ever GPL from pre-2000 vintage. A potentially outstanding wine, its proprietor, Xavier Borie, has fashioned a classic Pauillac, with a saturated dark ruby/purple color, a sweet nose of cassis fruit and spice, full body, superb concentration, and moderate tannin in the heady finish. This large-scaled 1993 avoids the tannin and austerity of many of its peers. Drink it between 2000-2015. Bravo!R.P.90/100

Really nice nose, great fruta

Lots of tannins. Well balanced with bold black fruit.drink 2025-2038

Blockbuster! Wasn't sure when I pulled it, Parker says, 96, I couldn't agree more, actually even higher for me! So fresh, so decadent, smooth as silk, the Tannins are well developed, the acidity ultra balanced, the Plum, Cherry with a touch of sandal wood! Yummy

Summary: this is it. Full stop. No need to say more. It is sublime, perfectly balanced, so powerful, layered and complex. Truly mind blowing at its age. Wow. 

On the nose: leather, tar, mushroom, cedar, oak, tobacco, pencil shavings, black fruit, some spices, vanilla and a touch of smoke. 

On the palate: so powerful, then still some juicy black fruit, some spicy touches, lots of tobacco and oak, some chewy leather and mushrooms and incredible length on the finish. 

Points: 19

On the nose dark fruit initially opening up in the course of the evening and bringing along liquorice, vanilla and spice.

On the palate velvety tannins and exceptional balance and finish.

Ready now, drink up!
Very good to drink!!!!

Opaque purple core with a tawny rim. Intoxicating and intense perfume of cassis, cedar, graphite and hint of tobacco. Leaning towards the savory end of the spectrum. Dense, youthful and edgy. The medium bodied palate is supported by vibrant acidic black fruits transitioning to a mouth-filling blueberry liqueur sweetness on the long finish. Tannins still pretty chalky.  The wine lost its balance about an hour after uncorking, becoming more acidic and tannic - a strange development.

This is one of the best years i have been lucky to test. Outstanding classic Pauillac nose., very rural and great purity of fruit in the mouth that has soft but smooth tannins which hold it together in a fantastic structure. The taste buds are given a treat and it lasts for 45 seconds or more and changes throughout. Great

Great Bordeaux at 6 years of age just leaves me thinking how much more amazing it will look in 20 years‚Äô time. The oak is still fairly present now but if you‚Äôre looking for the complete package that will age sublimely then, well, I‚Äôm glad I‚Äôve got another 5 of these to hide in the cellar and forget about for the medium to long term. Harmonious, good intensity, but above all balanced and crisp. 13.5%. Cork. Drink 2032-40++

Very nice wine, with dark fruit, tobacco, herbs, seductive aroma, polished tannin that integrated fruits and secondary as a whole, with delicious acidity.
Already in its prime and a little air was what it needed to open up! 
One of my best wines apart from pontet canet.

Pretty much faultless. Dark red fruits and a hint of creosote. The only knot quibble is that it didn‚Äôt revolve much over the evening, but that was hardly an issue since it was pretty much perfect from the first sip

Very nice Bordeaux - evolved so much as it opened up. Very nice black fruit notes with slight red fruit notes that gives it brightness but also backed with a strong minerality and tobacco and earth that is classic Bordeaux. Nose has a nice oak, vanilla and barnyard with some lemon in it as well at the end.  Really enjoyed this wine!

This is almost as good as it gets! Fantastic aromas of mature wine. Some pencil, and a bit oak. The palate is impressive. Complex and concentrated wine with some tannins-soft ones. Keeps developing in the mouth, make me want to just keep it there. Impressing!

I like this more as the night went on. Needs to be decantered for at least 30-45 mins. Still a bit young and could be a better vintage in 2-3 years. Good nose, with hints of  black fruit on the tongue. Mid body and good hints of tannins. Probably better if I had a full bodied wine with my steak tonight but still enjoyed this bottle. Overall 4.1

Impressive and sturdy. Tannins at bay. Smooth silky. Needed decanting. Lots of sediment. Was still lively. Probably at its peak will not get better. Cork was a heavily purple was worrisome but did not prove fatal. A true experience.
Bouquet of Walnuts and macadamia. And a hint of Myanmar rum. Stranded in paradise.

An oldie but a goodie it's still got some kick in fact it's even still got some darker red in colour when I was expecting more brick red. The nose is soft maybe worn. 5. Grand cru classe. Very dense tobacco, cigar, cedar with oaky charecters. Green bell pepper, lavender and some floral notes are coming at the end. Med tannins, med acidity. Well balanced complex wine from left bank.

1961. Very small yield, severe crop loss, but surviving grapes were just outstanding with beautiful concentration. This wine stood up to his birthyear in royal fashion. It was still dancing on the tongue with beastiness. On the nose, powerful scents of leather, leaves and quite unique orange zest.

Well evolutioned wine with leather , red fruit and oaky aromas. Still ruby color with medium tannins and acidity. Also medium body. Flavors of cherry, cranberries, leather and tobacco. Medium aftertaste.

Seductive nose of black fruit, cedar, crushed stone, flowers and forest floor, soft mouthfeel with cashmere texture, remarkable depth and excellent precision, ripe aromas of blackcurrant, redcurrant, plum, tobacco, mocha and licorice mixed with earthy sous-bois undertones, well-rated acidity and dissolved tannins leading to an amazingly long finish. At the very beginning of the drinking window, this is a delightful wine with ethereal poise, impeccable balance and captivating charm.
It‚Äôs deliciously lush 5‚≠ê!

Have to open up for a few hours, big difference on the palate. right after opening you get strong aromatics of earthiness, smoke and pungent violets. On the palate is short, muted and watery, but the wine opens up nicely and enjoyed it much better after a few hours. Could use a few years more in the bottle but worth drinking now. 4.3

#1 of 2: This Left Bank Bordeaux blend (78/22, CS/Merlot) has an inky, reddish purple hue, thick legs, and a spicy, dark berry nose; a med+ body, 14.5% ABV, smooth raspberry and plum, with a cigar box edge, nice acidity and soft tannins; and a lusciously earthy finish.
Pricey, but nice!

If you could put the fall season into a bottle, this would be it. The fruit from younger Bordeaux is long gone, leaving more animalistic impressions. Very good wine which provides an interesting experience, but peaked several years ago.

I made short ribs and this is what my friend mike brought.  Dark purple with full body and a lovely young vibrancy. This is a red Bordeaux from the Pauillac area. The winery states that this 2005 vintage is one of their best and I believe it. A blend of 75%CS, 20%Merlot and 5% CF with vines averaging 50 in age. This is a superb, big red wine. For those who like classic, Bordeaux wine, this is the wine for you. A perfect example of a well balanced wine. No hint of age and bright red fruit in the nose and finish. Pepper and a bit of tobacco and vanilla linger in the nose as well. At about $135, it delivers the goods.

Grand-Puy-Lacoste night.

The key elements were present but not harmonious. Big bouquet. Graphite, tobacco and lead. Fruity. Strong tannin structure. Still sharp. Medium finish.

Lack complexity and structure but otherwise good value and very drinkable.

Undecanted.  Deep garnet.  Pron. nose of Angelica root, leather, pencil lead, dark cherry.  So comforting in a way!  M+ body.  Pronounced intensity of graphite and burnt wood.  H tannins still powerful.  Mid acids.  Long finish of soot.  Unmistakably Pauillac!  Always dependable 5me Cru.

A Bordeaux 2018 horizontal, purportedly to celebrate early a phenomenal vintage..

...well, it's TOO early. Though the wines have been decanted for hours before serving, they failed to bloom properly. 

Nose flashed bright on first pour, but remained duds after that. 

Both the two Right Banks already showed some complexity on the palate, promising richness in the years ahead. The Left Banks were more leaner, reserved.

This was our first Pauillac. It was purchased as one of a case lot assortment ( more ratings of other wines to follow) . This was a very enjoyable although complex bottle. We wonder if we'd missed it's prime "drink by" date as this was a 1995 bottling. Would love others comments on this please.

20-10-2013. Colour: Redbrown, orange-brown rim according to its age. Nose not very prominent at first, takes a few minutes, than comes with a hint of a cool cellar, filled with red fruit, not very persistent. Tastes fleshy, tannines, stays long on the tongue and pallate

Cassis, sandalwood, copious mint and sweet herbs, smoke and incense. Great line of acidity and a long finish. Excellent and far more lively than another bottle I had a few years ago (different source).

Beautiful wine, still very youthful with some leather, cedar and meaty aromas starting to express themselves. Dark cherry and plum with cassis dominate the fruit. Is silkier than you might expect from a Paulliac from this excellent year.

Aroma: blackcurrant, blueberry and other dark cassis. Secondary notes of cedar wood, pencil, tobacco and some earth. 

Palate: Full bodied, present tannins and acidty, but still remains quite silky. Ok longevity. 

Verdict: after having lots of burgundy, it was nice with a change of scenery. Quite classic bordeaux, with all of the characteristics and style factors.

An excellent bottle in prime maturity finally after waiting (and trying) over the last decade. Good garnet Color with no sign of fading and medium to full body. Tastes of cassis, dark plums and vanilla oak after initial whiff of inkiness blown off. Now as harmonious as it will get and drinking beautifully in a zalto glass with Ontario beef tenderloin and grilled tuna. 94pts

This wine is intense, opened in 2021 which was too early and definitely requires decanting. Powerful aromas of graphite, green herbs, cassis and tobacco along with some truffle. Full-bodied and dry with gripping, tight tannin. High acidity. Flavors of cassis, ripe blackberry, damp earth and some licorice on the finish.

Powerful Bordeaux. Our bottle struggled to open up possibly pushing peak drinkability. Smells of cellar with underlying black cassis and fig. Taste however of smooth fruity blackberry, cassis and cherry. Subtle tannins. Long finish.

3.6

Bottle breathing for 4-5 hours. Dark red purple in color, initial nose of wood spice and leaves changed to wonderful nose of black fruits, tobacco and wet earth after 2 hours... I could smell this pleasant sweet nose all day in my office cubicle until I recorked it to restaurant!

On the palate full bodied, rich and round tannins with loads of ripe black fruits, cedar and wood... Long and sweet finish! 
What a gorgeous and beautiful wine!

Dark fruit, predominantly black currant and tar with slight leather and menthol tones. Still quite tannic this wine will keep a long time yet. I had decanted it for a couple of hours but was more integrated after running through an aerator. Quite big with a long finish from a muscular vintage. 92 points

On the earthy side for sure with notes of cedar, leather, smoke, brown sauce aroma, black currant, and black cherry. Concentrated , silky feel. Long finish. Too young for sure, but we weren‚Äôt able to wait on this bottle.

For me personally this wine while good was lacking based on price point and expectation.  The wine was wonderfully soft -  it still had light bits of red fruit on the palate like raspberry but it was a little washed out.  There were tannins that persisted through the finish giving me the impression that this wine had not totally gone over the hill - it had some cedar but was lacking in the complexity of secondary notes I love in older Bordeauxs. Length on the finish was above average but not stellar.

Surprisingly good for a less well rated vintage. Quite a flat vegetal nose made me worried but much more fruit coming through when you taste it. Still seems quite tight and closed but nice clean acidity so maybe a work in progress that will better in a couple of years

74 CS/23 M/ 3 CF blend for this young Pauillac. Hot and extraordinary vintage. 
Med crimson. Black currants, cassis, tobacco leaves and dusty sous bois bouquet. Med/full body, bright acidity and rather tannic. Very stony on the palate. Good persistence. To cellar for at least 6-8 yrs

Very nice Bordeaux from a justly celebrated vintage. Deep purple in color. Sweet tobacco and black currant on the nose. Palate of blackberry and well-integrated oak, with leather on the medium+ finish. Good mouthfeel. Well worthy of being served with a hardy Christmas dinner.

Bricking on the appearance gave away the age of the wine.  Secondary nose of tea leaves, kamquat and a hint of forest floor.  Respectable attack on entry although there was a slight dried out on the finish.  Orange peel, dried date, tobacco and a swift kick of tannins on the palate.  Text book aged claret.  I was quick (too quick) to nail this as a late 70s left bank.  I could not tell how great GPL was in the 60s but the level of vibrancy tells a lot about the vintage.

Usual Bordeaux notes but has a manuka honey note on top. Dry, mild tannins now, lighter minerals, leather and easy to drink. It‚Äôs already got some of the older flavors of old leather shoes, mild smoke.

Ruby garnet coloring, high intensity. Aromas of red cherry, cassis, glycerin, mint, and oak. Cool palate of mint, cedar, blueberry , and blackberry. High tannins and medium acidity, super solid Bordeaux from an incredible year. 17/20.

Medium garnet. Fragrant black fruits in the nose. Palate is quite silky, full of dark fruits, still very primary and only slightly secondary, civilized and polished, well integrated though still a bit tight, very long finish

Nonetheless, it is always a treat to taste a 25‚Äìyr old BDX. This is heavy into its evolution but still possessing plenty of fruit to give it another 5, possibly 10-years if stored correctly.

I really think the GPL back in the 80s is a much better wine. Shoulder to shoulder to a lot of the grand crus back in the 80s. No less than a lynch bages. Beautiful nose of cassis and tobacco. Still a lot of fruit. Love it.

Mooie Bordeaux uit 2012. Goed op dronk in 2022. Kan nog wel een paar jaar liggen. Redelijke neus met een uitstekend voorproefje van de smaak. Aards. Donker fruit, pruimen, leer, verrassend zuurtje van groene appel. Middelhoog tanine. Alcoholpercentage van 13,5% komt er wat bovenuit. Niet geheel in balans, dus geen 5 sterren. Green grass after breathing gives way to mellow light cherry plums, with complex undertones waiting to open up, acidity tinge high but mellows into smooth tannin after 30 mins bottle breathing, pair with grilled nuts amidst cool weather around 26 deg C, perfect 1st warm up red. After 1 hour, Paulliac nose very distinctive smooth tannin with complex opening up pair with Italian pizza with ham and sausage.

Drink it up if you have this wine that still has some life but definitely past its prime. The blackberry, currants and black cherry notes have conceded to the more prominent cigar box and rosemary flavors. Despite a fading wine, I must admit that I have a soft spot for aged Bordeaux.

Earthy at first. Red fruit a little mint. Towards the end of dinner the smell was very vibrant and fruity . It got younger and more elastic. But then on the palette you taste a cliff.. a pruney wet cliff that I had to deduct some marks for . The length is good. It has character though

Round feel. Rich Cab flavors dominating with blackberry, cedar, and stone. There's a bit of spearmint on the nose, as well.  Still quite muscular and tannic, I think it requires 5-10 more years in the bottle before it really sings.

A blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot and 5% Petit verdot.
Well-developed, rounded, harmonious but very powerful wine.
Greatly balanced tannins and fruity structure.
Aroma from cassis, blackcurrant, plum, leather, cedar, smoke, vanilla, mushroom and forest floor.

A very matured Pauillac which takes just about 15 minutes to reach the "perfect" peak. I would describe this as smooth and velvety, not in your face but with a nice finesse. Pretty complex still with some really pleasant finish. I had this over 2 hours and it did well to maintain very well throughout the time after 15 minutes. Overall a very pleasant drink that's ready and fully matured for a great drinking experience with closed friends and family.

Typical ruby-black with a little bit of deposit. Gorgeous classic nose of concentrated inky blackcurrant with a bit of pencil lead, still showing wood and a tiny touch of capsicum. Palate is silky smooth and still with plenty of structure - nose is well ahead - with plenty of black olive and pepper underneath the fruit. Lacks the fruit concentration for something of this pedigree perhaps?

Tasted blind. After a good decant it still took some time to present itself. Smells wonderful and very much like a good aged Bordeaux. Very savoury through the palate. Touch of green olive. Red and blue fruits still present. Some herbs. Cigar box. A bit short on the finish and maybe just a tad oxidised. Solid though.

Great QPR - bought it for $100 in year 2020. Barely little fruits left with faint hint of red currant, hawthorns, earth and fungi. This bottle of 44yrs 750ml aged and held up well. Given a chance, I‚Äôd like to try it in a larger format.

A very nice surprise.  Has held up well with strong tannins and good acidity and a wonderful nose of cassis, pencil lead, green pepper and plum or softened red fruit.  Fruit was not as apparent upon opening but the wine really balanced as it opened up and warmed.  Tannins softened, the acidity took a back seat and fruit showed up in a well balanced harmony. Notwithstanding the age, this wine will hold up even longer. Very impressive showing all the way around.

This is a simply wonderful wine, bought as a future, not so affordable now. It is beautifully deep, mellow, and balanced, did not need more than minutes of breathing time, lasting somewhat longer amongst five of us‚Ä¶

Unique nose. Earthy, musky and elegant. Medium bodied and absolutely perfect with lamb chops. Gorgeous with cheese. Mild tannins. Holds itself in the aftertaste, but medium long. Totally enjoyed it. Highly recommend, very drinkable.

Dark fruits, leather and cocoa.  The wine is very deep and complex.  The time is now....The tannins have completely softened and the wine is silky. After about 20 min it starts losing the fruit.  More time will not make this better.

This wine sadly didn‚Äôt live up to expectations.  A lot of smoke and sharp tannins on opening that never really opened up to the dark fruit I was expecting from this classic.  It faired better when paired with food but never really shone. Disappointed.

Give it some time in the glass and it balances out nicely.  Well-integrated oak, medium to full body in the mouth, firm tannins and a good amount of fruit.  The question is how much longer the fruit can stand up to the tannins.  I'm betting at least 10 to 15 more years.

Perfect on the nose, restraint yet seductive because of the vanilla and cedar flavor. You can literally smell the acidity together with the black cherry and red currant, making it so freshly fragrant that I could spend minutes just sniffing. Yet it is still too young a bottle that the tannins hit the tongue and the buds would close immediately and the tasting is like a step function without smoothness. The finish is long and lasting though. Should have put it in the cellar for three more years.

Starting really developing well after 30 mins of decanting and was drinking well by the 2.5 hour mark. Cherries, herbs and tobacco on the nose. More tertiary notes on the palate and I could really taste minerals, some licorice and soy, herbs and dried cherries. Finishing is long.

4.1 for me

Following a 2005 Talbot this had a very savoury quality about it. Toasty on the nose, deep blackcurrant/cassis on the palate, almost gamey. Finish not as good as I would have expected but again the Talbot was magnificent in this regard.

This dry medium full bodied Margaux is the result of blending 62% cabernet sauvignon, 36% merlot and 2% petit verdot.
It had an obvious amethystine coloration to it with brilliant ruby color. 
The aromas of blackberry and spice introduced a palate with strong tannins and high acidity. 
Took the time to taste this one during the Union des Grands Crus de Bordeaux event held in Montr√©al.

The more known of the Rauzan estates splinted from its 17 century mega estate, clean and smooth, deep burgundy color, elegant style, lean with understated power reserve, nose smells of hibiscus, raspberry, pomegranate, blackberry, black currant, incense and clove, full body with balanced acidity and firm tannin, tastes similar to the nose with refined mouthfeel, long finish with licorice and cassis aftertaste.

Classic left bank Bordeaux nose with tons of cassis, cedar, dark forest fruits. On palette med body with med+ acidity. Elegant and almost silky. Very pretty but still a little baby. Need much more time in the cellar yet already very drinkable.

This Rauzan is one of the best I‚Äôve tasted: earthy beetroot and dark fruit, cool tobacco, off the scale intensity. I do believe that 2016 may turn out to be one of the best ever years in Bdx.
A blend of (mostly) CS, with M, PV and CF this is robust stuff for Margaux. Couple of decades yet?

Pure class and elegance. Seductive nose. Smooth silky tannin, restraint when the wine attack your taste bud at the first instance but can feel loads of red fruits about to burst in the mid palate. After a few hours, the black fruits show up and the wine is more powerful. Also the oak character such as vanilla. Delicious.

What an incredible young Margaux. A blend of 56% CS, 40% Merlot, 2% CF and 2% PV. Deep ruby colour, purple hue. Perfumed explosion, notes of blackcurrants, bilberries, violets, tar, smoke, earth, toast, charcoal, touch if smokiness. Full body, seductive and concentrated layers of black fruits, floral and earthy tones, chocolate hints and jammy undertones. It is intense, dense, youthful and vibrant with cashmere tannins. It will enter drinking window only in around 6 years but it is outstanding already.

Elaborate taste Margaux! Dry. A little bit spicy. High acidity. Strong tannin feeling. Rather strong oak feeling. Hint of blackberry or blueberry. Full body. Long and balanced finish. Smooth. I felt it had typical great elegant Margaux taste, and total balance was very good. Good berry-like taste with nice black floral aroma came in the first attack, and then aftertaste was long and balanced with nice earthy feeling. Rich and round. Good pairing with Japanese style grilled chicken "Yakitori."

Wow. Perfectly balanced and although very young is surprisingly accessible. With so much power this is definitely worth getting for the cellar. Classic Margaux, with red currant blackcurrant, graphite, tobacco, and that signature earthy note.

Deep purple colour. Pronounced nose with black pepper, tobacco, blackcurrant, cedar and vanilla. Pronounced taste of blackcurrant, black pepper, vanilla, cedar and tobacco. Long and dry finish. High acidity. High tannins. Medium body. A very good Margaux that could be stored for decades with great potential. Goes well with beef or lamb.

Oh wow.  Bring me 2 more bottles of this and wake me up on Thursday.  Deep(-) garnet.  Gorgeous Margaux perfume, generous fruit and a touch of rose.  Some smoked meat, earth, cedar quickly emerging.  Blackberry, black cherry, tobacco.  Silky on the palate, chocolate, minerals.  Dry and savoury for sure but stays very easy to drink.  Medium(+) body and tannins, high acidity. 92 points. A beauty in the making - but currently more of a beast showing several characteristics of the 2015 vintage. Big, fleshy and opulent with loads of fruit and dark notes of tobacco, roasted coffee etc. If time softens the edges this will be stunning!

Blind tastings. Rauzan Segla 1996. Color demonstrates matured  wine. At first gives strong leather and cassis aroma which dissipates in 15 min in the glass. Ripen berries and slight hints of chocolate on tetriary nose.  Very pleasant elegant tannins therefore Margaux easily guessed. Light, velvet and racy. Seductive and well balanced. Medium long finish. Really liked it. The bottle is gone fast with just bread and olive oil which buttress its finesse.

Backlog from April. Rauzan Segla vertical, 2015. Tasted a bit out of order, after the older vintages. Blackberry, vanilla, ripe dark plum, chocolate, soil, earthy hint. Smooth, dry tannin. Ripe, berrish palate, silky and refined. Halfway maturity wise between the 2006 and 2019 tasted previously.

Black cherry, with earthy notes on the noise, the aromas explode out of the glass. Medium to high tannins, tastes of cherries and minerals can be felt throughout. Good color and smooth feel. Great wine, drink now if you can. 95/100

Easy to see the true potential captured in this bottle. A vast array of red and black fruits, licorice, cassis, chocolate, cedar, black pepper, chocolate, earth and truffle notes, deep, complex and with a long long finish. Although not a chateau that I have previously been overly fond of, today this bottle showed me the quality and elegance that this house is capable of. Strong nose of dark fruit, cocoa, dark chocolate, toast and earth. It has medium body with similar notes on the palate with well integrated oak (cedar, dark chocolate and toast) and a finish that goes on forever. This wine could live on for another 15 years or more.
Cherries, lavender and thyme with some plum come from the glass. Dense, silky and long palette of dark fruit and sweet tannins.
Distinct nose of black fruits. Full bodied dark purple color. Blackcurrant, vanilla, tobacco and spice. Balanced acidity and tannin. Long finish.

Bordeaux: an assessment of the wines of 2014, 2015 & 2016 from Cru Class√©s & their associated properties. 31/56. 68/30/2 CS/M/PV. Barrel sample.

Med purple. Very pretty & attractive w. m+ aroma intensity. Floral, ripe & generous w. blackcurrant, cassis, blackberry, plum & blueberry. Youthfully plush.

Dry. Vanilla oak cream & soft ripe blackberry, blackcurrant & cassis. Fleshy & rich w. generosity. High tannins are tight & structured currently (understandably), high acid, full body & a m+ oaky finish.

Bordeaux en primeur.

Margaux are usually on a more calm side the paillacs, st estephes, etc and this one has a feminine elegance in addition. Quality has risen here since a while and in '16, the outcome is an irresistible nectar. Will be hard to resist.

This wine is a deep purple with a garnet rim and a high intensity of aroma. The nose is composed of blackberries, grilled strawberries, eucalyptus, grape, honey(?), vanilla, smoked meat, and charred oak. This wine is dry with med+ acidity, high alcohol, high tannins, a full body and a long finish. The palate is consistent with the nose. Overall this is an outstanding wine that is suitable for further ageing.
What a delicious wine to start our weekend with, opened and decanted it and it is drinking perfectly. A bit of oak, full bodied and a decent length on the palate. Can thoroughly recommend this wine.

I had this wine a couple of weeks ago and my actual review never went through... I remember enjoying it but I don‚Äôt remember tasting notes!
Black fruits, oak, leather, vanilla. Complicated but balanced smell, bold, high tannic, long finished. Fantastic as I wished.
Barn yardy and mineral on the nose and palate. Firm tannins with good structure. Still youthful and fruity. Drinking very well
Excellent red with a subtle nose and still a lot of character left. We had it in Napa, but at a French restaurant:) Thanks goodness for corkage.
Red soft red hue, nose of spice and fruit. Mouth very soft cinnamon and mild chocolate. Long finish, delicious. Can wait for another 5 years
Cassis, cherry, compotte. Sugar, slight hint of coffee. Still youthful. Young. Slightly leathery. Mint. Chocolate. Very intense. - 94
Big nose colour still dark red on the palate red fruit vanilla bark dark chocolate this wine can still keep some really enjoyed

Black currant with leaves in a leather pocket. Velvety and deep body. Extraordinary Bordeaux
Decanted 3 hours. Appear with blackberry, Jasmine, and plum aromas. Not elegant as 2000's but more intense and longer finish.
leather oak blackcurrant vanilla chocolate - like a piano concerto, classic, balanced, perfect for a quiet and beautiful fall evening

Amazingly aged! Tasted a bit like port and smelled very deep like old cranberries. 

Fantastic, had it at Praelum Wine Bistro on 9 May 2019.
A very solid Bordeaux. Aged well, could have lasted another 5 years. Still had some tannins and acid, but good. Nice balance
Strong berry flavor, sweet and smooth taste with a little bit smoky and bitter aftertaste. Easy to drink even right after opened.
A great wine. Cassis and earthiness on the nose. Very well balanced on the palate - tannins, acidity and fruit expression. Long finish.
Fresh. Natural notes and cherry notes. Cedar, cream. Full body. Good balanced. Very fresh. Nice tannins. Nice after with chocolate.
Initially closed but blossoms after 20 minutes.  Deep and brooding but balanced. Good length and lovely cassis bramble and tabacco.

Delicious.  Still plenty of red fruit

Leather, Smoke, complex, structured, powerful. Beautiful distinct long bitter finish. Great wine, enjoing it too much to worry about tasting notes.
From a double magnum bottle. Fantastic both on the nose and the palate, with a long long finish. Served with a great lunch at Rauzan Segla
Very light tannin backbone. Roasted plum in the nose. Bold and dry. Baked red fruit. Hint of tobacco and leather. Bit of vanilla.

Medium ruby colour. Coconut, chocolate, blackcurrant, medicinal.
Dry, medium acidity, high alcohol, medium(+) tannins, medium(+) intensity.

91 Points, drink from 2022 until 2035. Deep purple with dense black aspects. Nose of toasted oak and tobacco leaves, licorice and fresh leather, rye bread and malt, bitter almond and chocolate, red berries and some vegetables. Very tannic on the palate, rather austere and rustic, somehow ancient and authentic, but not very appealing in this stage. Wait!
Tight at first. Takes a while to open.  Nice acidity. Blueberry and oak dominates. Medium body, more on the heavy side vs the typical Margaux. Medium long finish, floral nose after an hour +.
I think this is a wine that is generally ready to drink. However, it may be good to leave it a little longer. The tannins are smooth. Plum, raspberries, mint, and minerals.
94 points. Vintage 2019 opened in 2022. Tasted at the weekend des Grands Cru in Bordeaux.

Loads of freshness and pleasure in this 2014, instant fruits support by full structured body and oak. Long finish

Loved this wine. Tasted alongside malescot st supery and Beame-cantenac as part of 2018 vinous tasting class.  Big wow here.  Layers of complex flavors and such.  No wonder I believe Neal Martin rates this 100 pts.

Very beautiful and charming fresh violet, black and blue fruits, lots of graphite mineralites, smoke, cedar, hint of undergrowth. Supple and velvet on palate with noticeable tobacco and truffle notes. So long and satisfactory. One of the best of the vintage. Tasted twice. One of the best Rauzan Segla !

68% Cabernet Sauvignon 30% Merlot and 2% Petit verdot. Classy and elegant
So round and balanced in mouth gives off a nice sweetness and a long finish. In nose, dark fruit, cassis also a bit vegetal but not in a negative way.

We had the Lascombes 2005 in the glass beside this one, i was the only one i think that preferred this one over that Lascombes. This was very good, soft and silk!
Sequence of tasting was maybe not best. Well balanced, red fruit, beautiful aged and still fruity. Wining on the way to Paris @[1|937288|Mark van Delft]
Excelente Bordeaux with bold  aromas of black fruit and oak. Medium plus tannins and acidity. Flavors of blackberry, oak and strawberry. Medium plus aftertaste.

Nose black fruit oaky

Amazing nose. Bouquet of lavender, tea, floral notes, plums, soy. Palate is medium+, not as expressive as nose. Medium finish.
Could probably go on for another couple of decades, yet is at a wonderful stage of ageing with big red fruit notes and a menthol element on the palate. A real pleasure.
Prominent spice and cigar box to begin with, but this died down after a short decant.  Still in a secondary phase of flavours, with a smooth long structure.
Not at the same wow factor as the 2005, but still an excellent wine. I probably didn‚Äôt leave it decanted enough. It does need a few more hours to soften to perfection.
Earthy, cigar box and tobacco over black fruit. Very complex. In it‚Äôs prime after 17 years. Decant or let open in the glass for 30 minutes, and wow! Lovely Bordeaux
My first tasting of this monumentous house & what a tasting it was! Mixture of cherries and black currants, spice and vanilla, earth and leather....wow!
Ruby colour. Delicate developed nose with cedar, black cherry, dried dates, black cherry and oak. Mellow, light bodied palate following the nose. Very nice.
Red fruit, cedar, perfume, complex. Still full bodied, balanced, soft as silk, structured, lots of red fruit. Sheer pleasure, long aftertaste. What a wine
Dense, full-bodied, still tight. Powerful, but this power still needs time to reveal itself. Dark fruit, cigar, cedar, baking spice, high acidity and tannins, long.
Dry, blackberry and blackcurrant aromas, spicy, forrest floor, mushroom, leather, tobacco and smoke on the palate, medium tannins, full bodied, rounded, long lasting
Well rounded complex leathery finish with good balance of charcoal, and deal intense fruit. This wine can wait longer for what could be an even more elegant finish.
Nice deep ruby, noise with oak blackcurrant blackberry with a medium finish. This bottle need to get oxygen, open it 2.5 hours before d√©gustation and it was perfect
Excellent perfectly aged bottle. Worth drinking now, some orange and brown on rim of glass. Cigar box, cedar, still some nice fruit, bramble. Full body. Really awesome!
Depp Ruby as expected. Intensely smooth. No deep finish. But delicious with great flavour. Very nice. Especially for the price, really good value wine
Surprisingly my favourite of the three vintages - 2000, 2008 and 2011. Dried fragrant violets, very fresh black fruits, vanilla, blueberries, high acidity.

Leather, tobacco, cigar box, pencil shavings.... excellent Margaux if you like these favours.... long lingering after taste. Wonderfully marriage with Thai food.
92 pts. It's a Margaux, Yo Yo! And still alive. Depth. Velvet tannines, forest fruit, dark chocolate and tobacco. Very well balanced. Long rich finish.
Superb wine. Tannins still need a bit more time to smooth out. Wonderful nose that never flattened out as time went on. Looking forward to next bottle! RP 95 WE 95

Dense, dark purple-red color in the glass! On the nose intense notes of black and blue ripe fruit, blackcurrant, blueberry and a hint of vanilla! On the palate full-bodied with soft tannins and a long, persistent finish! Cheers!

Appearance: ruby red, medium intens, clear. 
Nose: developing, medium intens, clean condition. Aromas of red fruit, cassis, blackberry, hint of cinnamon, red cherry, hint of capsicum, chalky minerality. 
Palate: dry, medium intens, medium (+) acidity, medium body, medium finish, clean polished tannins. 
Assessment: very good wine. Great aging potential. Too young to drink.

Deep crimson color, bouquet of aromatic red and black fruits, palate of medium tannin, can taste the youngness of this vintage, this is a good effort as you can taste good structure and balance in this not so great vintages

Such a beautiful wine and in perfect condition in 2022. Mild, milky, silky structure but tanins are still present. I would say that mostly Red and Black berries, some cherry, even some cranberry, May be a little high acidity! But averall a great impression.

Medoc 2nd Growth. Steady oaky nose with muted fruitiness, but balance of acid as well as fine tannins is good enough. Cassis, plum, leather, tobacco, pepper and vanilla. Very tough vintage, but enjoyable. At Grand Marche du Vin in Ginza.

Top Margaux.

16/20

palate: forrest fruits, purple fruit, perfect ripeness of fruit, good density.

Smooth on the palate. Flavors of black fruits, oak, with a faint minerality. Low tannins and soft, low acidity. Very delicious!
A wine in its prime. Medium-bodied, ripe, fresh, firm and loaded with sweet blackberry and tobacco leaves. Finishes long with dusty tannins, dried herbs. Superb with Steak au Poivre.
The label by Karl Lagerfeld makes a perfect math to the wine - a haute couture Margaux. Dense, fool bodied and brooding. A stunning wine but be sure to decant and serve at below 20 degrees.

2007.. Good body smooth semi dry with layered flavours.. yummy

Very strong, bold, earthy and leathery. Nicely balanced, but not my cup of...wine.

Beautiful dark colour and great taste but not perfectly balanced.

Ruby color, slightly plum. Earthy with a hint of cherry, tobacco. A very pleasant wine, though powerful and quite complex. The wine was enjoyed with a medium rare ribeye.
Surprisingly young after 16 years, took it a while to open up. When it did, had all expected from it, everything at its place, most noticeably the silk in the aftertaste.
More red fruits then black in this vintage. Loads of character including pencil shavings and coffee grounds. Med plus acid med plus finish. Decanted 2.5 hours.

A big wine with character and finesse.  Beautiful nose of coffee, leather, cedar, tobacco.  Well integrated tannins and fine tannins.  Very drinkable with more cellaring potential.  @[1|1162819|Dominic Goh]

ALMIGHTY RAUZAN SEGLA! 

I have drank many vintages of Rauzan Segla, most impressive? Probably 85/86, and borderline 82. This 2000 is not far off, a reputable production from a great vintage. I remembered about 3 years ago in a non first growth blind tasting of 2000, this one came up as an undisputed #1. What's the attraction? From the nose with chunky oak and deep dark black fruits, to the palette with very rich, ripe and voluptuous fruits. Deserved some attention from Bordeaux lovers.

Yihaaa, what a wine üëåüòã! Intense, exuberant and at the same time delicate. Powerful bouquet, cassis, exotic spices, cedar wood, rose petals, violet, simply smells elegant yet intense. Delicate tannins, smooth and very long, more cassis, cloves, smooth leather and cedar. Excellent and a keeper üëåüëç will last for another two decades. Wonderful combo with lamb fillet and morels.

I was very surprised by how much fruit you still get on this wine after 39 years.Smooth mouth feel with notes of well aged tobacco and hint of raisin.little cellar must on the finish with very light tannins.Great wine experience with great friends.

Deep garnet, brown on the edges, with oak dominating the bouquet and the top palate.  There's no hint of fruit but rather a mature wine with solid backbone of roasted meat and vegetables. The tannins are soft but not quite silky.  Classic Margaux I would say.

Loved this, the best of the flight of GPL 2015, D'Armailhac 2010 (what a vintage!) and this my first Rauzan-Segla üá´üá∑ Super Bordeaux evening, thanks to bro RL for sharing these 3 wines which we went back and forth with enjoying! Really enjoying this fully mature Margaux this evening. The ‚Äò03 is right at its peak, yet is delivering a perfumed bouquet some primary dark fruit, with tertiary notes of barnyard and violets, sweet tannin and gentle acidity. Not the most intense on the palate but leaving a fairly long, lingering finish. Elegant. This is in a great spot right now and is a drink now rather than a hold for me. 4.6. 
53% CabS, 44% Merlot and 3% PV. Typical Margaux. Bell pepper, licorice, tobacco, mint, pepper. My favorite cranberries come to life after some time. Cherries. 
Decanting definitely recommended although all in all the wine feels quite ready. Tannins are soft and refined. Delicious!

2nd Cru class√© Margaux
Fresh red and black fruits, good acidity, med- astringency, medium body, alcohol volume is not felt. Excellent balance. 
Long finish, primary driven.
Thoroughly enjoyable.

Blind tasting with wine buddies... on the nose I picked up immediately it is a Bordeaux Medoc wine. It feels like a young gun with beautiful cinnamon, dark cherries and green herbaceous notes. The tannin is soft and grainy with nice balanced of acidity. The finishing is pretty good. Drinking very well but have huge aging potential. 4.3pt

Crimson-brick colored, complex dried berry and leather, with nuances of Indian spices, smoked meat and black truffles. Well structured in the mouth, liquid minerals intermixed with tobacco, smoke, black currants, melted licorice, and hints of dark berries. Full-bodied and elegant with layers of concentration and crispy tannins, in an intense and very delineated style. This wine is still an teen-ager in terms of its evolution, believe it or not! Hope to find another one soon.

Quite some evolution on the borders but still very concentrated and brick red. Mature red and black berries, leather, earthy, underwood, matured game, coffee. Fresh fruity attack, smooth, melted tannins and equilibrated and balanced, long elegant finish. An example of a well aged Margaux.

Great wine from one of my favourite vintages and one which is very underrated. Was very closed when first opened and needed an hour in decanter and some time in glass to fully reveal itself.  Fruit still prominent but tertiary flavours developing gicing the wine a lovely sense of aging. Plenty of years ahead of it and it was perfect with roast lamb

This wine shows why a good Margot needs age to show its true character. It has a wonderful structure and nice complexity.  A bit of fruit, a little smoke, and a very pleasant tannin / leather aftertaste. This is a great wine. If you could buy it for $44 as suggested by the app, you should do so. It was a pleasure to drink.

Margaux tasting 2020, The star of the evening! Another Diamond brought to us by @[1|3981616|Omar Daouk]! Special label made by Karl Lagerfield for the Chateau 150th anniversary!

4.7. If they were to put a Chanel dress into a bottle, this would be it! Absolutely elegant and super sexy in every way possible. Feminine Margaux nose with cigar box and cedar. Long silky creamy finish. Definitely in its drinking prime!

Aug 2014. First bottle I have opened. Nicely mature for the vintage. Big meaty nose. Sweet red berry fruit beef blood and herb de Provence. Quite long finish with well integrated tannins. Delicious if you like meaty wines. 94 points

Rauchiges Purpur mittlerer Intensit√§t, Bouquet mit exzellenten R√∂stnoten, Rauch, warmes Toast, schwarze und blaue Frucht, Pflaume, Cassis, am Gaumen rote saftige Kirschen, Himbeere, Erdbeere, rote Johannisbeeren, Veilchen, Minze im langen Abgang. In feinster Fruchtphase, wird spannend nach 5-10 Jahren wieder zu degustieren. Grossartig.

We had some friends and family last night and this was unanimously considered our best pick. 
I am trying to keep few bottles of this wine for few years but it has proven to be hard.
Fresh herbs, cocoa, blackcurrant, chalk, white truffles, and ripe black fruits.

Margaux evening bottle #2

Dark colored with dark fruits notes on a lush and dense body with a perfect acidity to balance that endless finish üí´

A wine that dreams are made of... 

Happy Bordeaux Sunday üç∑

4,6 High expectations but wow, meeting exceeding. Maybe because the wonderful dinner homemade by me and my mate Bj√∂rn. The wine worked excellent with morels sauce and lamb filet. Bouquet quite stiff in spite of decanted 4 hours before dinner. The an explosion of dark fruit, leather, fresh prunes and blackberry. Wonderful tannins in balance with fruit and acid. I wish we had another bottle.

A classic french wine. Almost 50/50 Cabernet and merlot blend. So simple yet the taste last forever and it was very consistent. The nose was as fruity as a Californian but much more earthy that gives away its french grapes. Very smooth considering its French acidity, yet it wasnt overwhelmed by the peppercorn i was having. Yet another great vintage from French. No surprise

Very elegant and aromatic. Aroma at still gives herbs, earthy, floral, while stirring gives chocolate and leathery. Smooth and well integrated tannin, good acidity, black and red currants and berries, chocolate, herbs, tea leafs, cloves. Long finish with herb and tea leaves. Well balance.

This wine was quite a surprise. I am always suspicious about Bordeaux post 90s and this wine was showing a lovely balance between fruit, wood, alcohol and structure. Margaux is always a good choice and this Rauzan-Segla showed a beautiful balance. Still a baby but very pleasant now.

Discovered this up in Husavik, Iceland, what a find. Still young but big and bold on the nose with all the old world notes, blackberry and currant dominant, this only softened after 2.5 hour decant which let the tannins and let the characteristics shine through , deep violet , wonderful complex  texture and will continue to age very well. I ordered the meal around the wine. Beef fillet cuts on the French menu, amazing!

Dark red colour, with slight brownish tinge indicative of the 11 years vintage when I opened it. Good staining on the base of the cork. Fragrant nose of ripe plums, nectarine and ripe berries. Medium plus body, tannic and dry, balanced structure with acidity on the higher side. Dark chocolate and cedar at the straight on, mellowing to vanilla overtones. Soft lingering finish.

Big wine, extreme complex structure, elegant and delicate. Mineral, velvet,  fullbodied, wellbalanced. Forrest floor, flowers, black currant, tobacco, leather, earthy on the palate, prominent smoke, mushroom as well. Rounded with long, precise and spicy finish.

Excellent producer, perfect vintage, good age, though the wine is still youngish and not at the peak yet. Dark color, beautiful classic aromas of ripe cassis, blackberry, prune, ripe cherry, dark chocolate, graphite. Full body, firm structure, mature tannins, well balanced, multilayered, detailed and delicious. Very sophisticated and long aftertaste.

Having this bottle at uncle Jake's after a pokehunt (caught an aerodactyl but missed a snorlax üò≠üò≠üò≠)

Dark deep ruby with brownish tinge. Full bodied. Blackcurrant, old worn leather, damp forrest floor, flower pot soil, graphite and some smell of pvc rubber pipe. Sour berries and mint on the palate. Super smooth tannins, medium acid, slight salty minerality, long dry finish

Amazing bottle. Fill and cork was remarkable and wine was brick red and more like a 1980s wine.  So smooth with floral aromas and still red cherry, leather and tobacco.  Kept waiting for it to decline but finished it before it did so

Chateau Rauzan Segla. Margaux. Grand Cru classe 2nd Growth. 2010 vintage. SGD204 from Farthinghoe. 

Color: Medium Ruby 

Nose: Pronounced intensity. Developing. oak tobacco graphite violet blueberry

Palate: Dry. Medium + tannins. Medium acidity. High alcohol. Full bodied with long finish. Flavour intensity is pronounced. cassis plum chocolate

Quality is Outstanding 

Drink now. Potential for aging. 

This will hold for a long long time!

A fresh bouquet of red fruited cherries, raspberries, orange peels, some smoke and graphites.  The palate unveils lots of red fruits, some pencil lead shavings and comes with silky tannins that provides some grip to keep the wine interesting.

Elegant wine that epitomizes Margaux. You will notice aromas of oak, vanilla, toast, brioche wafting to your nose immediately after uncorking. Then follows blackcurrant, cassis, blueberry, sour cherry, licorice, rosemary, cedar, tobacco, pepper, forest floor, potting soil and violet. Full bodied, silky tannins with medium plus acidity and a long finish. Superbly paired with a slow roasted beef short ribs. Decant for an hour and you‚Äôll have a beautiful wine that‚Äôs ready for drinking.

excellent surprise! 
usually i am not a fan of Rauzan, too tight, too much extracted with persistant tannins. but 30y after, wahou !!! fantastic expressive nose of leather, horse stall, violette flower. the mouth is a bit flat with classical style. not much excitement but what a solid structure and elegance at this age.

Hitting its peak now. Very well kept. Color still pale garnet with rim variation.
Took ~3hrs decant in glass to open. Beautiful evolution from primary fruit of raspberry, boysenberry & ripe plum; florals - crushed rose petal & violet. Evolving to cocoa, leather, pencil shavings and graphite. 
Palate mature with fine tannin only toward the finish, nice lingering acidity in the mid palate. Delicious savouriness. Body is Med- 
Finish relatively short but this was overall a very very enjoyable drink

Owned by the Chanel family, grew to fame recently. 60/40 Cs/M
Label by Karl Lagerfield, which is dedicated to 350th anniversary of the Estate.
Ok. First of all it will age really well for 25+ years easily. Do not drink it now, but cellar it.
Medium to deep garnet color. Blackberry and black currant flavours on the nose. Almost Full bodied, medium+ acidity, medium to high Alcohol (14%). 
Red cherry and blackcurrant on the palate. 
Youthful, tannins are super fine, long aftertaste, which needs to mature.

hetgenotschap.blogspot.com tasting night 2016: wow. 30 years old and right in it's best years I think. Superb velvetty structure, and the taste goes on and on. Berries and some mibt on the palate. Great.

When just opened, strong barnyard, closed palate. It needs quite a few hrs of air to open up.
üëÉmed currant, plum, barnyard, yeast w/ soy sauce, coffee. 
üëÑmed red fruits, plum, black berries. Salt, pepper & wood, herb note then evolved to 2ndary spices, integrated tannins w/ med+ acidity. Med+ finish of fruites, Licorice(++), pepper & herb. Very dry, med+ oily body.
Should be better 2 yrs ago. A little short palate but mostly balanced & savory. Good complexity & clearly defined. Peak in 2nd day. 4.2/5.0

Clean clear wine with a deep purple core, brick red edge with a distinct thin watery rim. Med+ viscosity. Rich nose of black fruit, black coffee grinds and cigar box. Slight hint of cedar and leather. Palate is dry with medium acidity and medium tannins. Refined balanced and possesses a good length and smooth finish.

Beautifully aged typical old world Bdx with great fruit, nicely integrated tannins and a great structure. Long and mouthwatering finish. Bottle was in great condition and could age some 5-10 years more. Amazing wine!

4.3@Merry christmas, all of vivino usersüéÑüéÖüéÅ‚ú®üéÑüéÖüéÅ‚ú®üéÑüéÖüéÅ‚ú®üéâüéâüéâüéâüéâ Alluring, elegant bit sexy & dusty aromas, riped mixed fruits, slight mint ? laced with smokes, still developing, but I did not regret opening today. It displayed aromas of blackberry, raspberry jam, dried fruits, fig, cherry, plum, oak, smoke, cedar, leathery. Elegant yet structured, degnified flavours, having contrast with still unriped, savory, grained tannins, which may let you feel more potentiality of this bottle.

Mature comforting leathery perfume. Opened a bit tight but settled well after two hours. The acid is at the forefront with very subtle mildly grainy tannins. The fruit tends to prune and red currant but there is still a lot of freshness. This is drinking well but the structure suggests will last a decade or two longer.

Coffee, chocolate/mocha and a whole bunch of red fruit still very present on this almost twenty year old wine. Tannins still definitely there with red fruits starting to mix with secondary flavours on the palate. Frightfully as a new world dominated wine drinker this wine still bucket loads of potential.

Excellent Margaux wine. Rich aromas and taste of cassis and earth. No tannins smooth and elegant. Improves with time open. Visited chateau today from uniworld river ship in paulliac. Medic region. Brought it back to share at dinner

This is a rich and plush wine, with a very forward nose of blackberry fruit intermixed with Proven√ßal herbs , underbrush, licorice, cedar, and chocolate.
Full -bodied and thick, yet very velvety, with lots of sweet fruit on the finish.
The wine is showing exeptionally well and seems to destined to drink, at least at this level of quality,for another decade!

Special Bordeaux we brought with us and had the somm open at our 10th anniversary dinner at Joel Robuchon Las Vegas. Decanted it as soon as we got there and it got better and better with breathing. After about two hours subtle earthy, spicy undertones started to emerge, which the somm said were the ‚Äútertiary‚Äù characteristics (not sure what was primary and secondary!). A lovely wine for a lovely evening.

Interesting travel back in history. Reminded me of when I was a kid and helped my dad store wines in his winecellar.

Bordeaux has changed a lot the last  20-30 years due to Robert Parkers preference towards more concentrated fruit.
This Margaux is light in colour and has a elegant bouquet of cedarwood, pencilshavings and some underlying blackberries.
The taste is due to its age very soft and mellow with hints of the soil in Margaux.

Clear, dark red colour with purple hue.
Nose of black fruits, charcoal, graphite, earth, dry bay leaf, with hint of floral and spice.
Medium body, subtle, velvet tannins with low acidity showing the vintage readiness.  A very elegant wine with long, lingering finish.a classy Margaux

Very good. Blackberry-themed nose, hints of cocoa; deep black cherry midrange, some balsa wood and earth; the finish is all black licorice and alder wood. The wine is complex, very balanced, quite an achievement. Highly recommended.

A full bodied well aged wine that goes great with red meat. It has a heavy oak and tobacco taste. Fairly heavy in sediments with strong blackcurrant and black fruit flavours. Great for drinking now. Highly recommended.

Tighter and ever so slightly more herbaceous than I would like on the nose. Dark fruits, cedar, floral elements, graphite and a hint of green stems. Powerful tannic structure, not fully ripe but not astringent. The fruit is still robust and needs, because of the structure, some matching intense food. We paired it with beautiful rare beef with fois gras medallions.

Life is too short & tomorrow is not guarantee.. Do what makes you happy, be w/those who makes you smile, have fun, fall in love,regret nothing, and love life!!!üç∑üç∑

After tango class having this beauty:))

Dense scarlet color
Aromas of figs,strawberries,tea leaves, cedar, spices & lilacs
Flavors of tangy cranberries
Fine chewy tannins & balanced acidity
Extremely  polished 
Long spicy finish

LoveüíÉüèª

Best Rauzan Segla I‚Äôve ever tasted. Maybe at peak now 202101. Strong and spread perfume from glass. Plum, tobacco, earth but still strong Cabernet flavor. On the palate, deep and dense but soft taste. It was so sophisticated and elegant. Everyone said delicious. 95pts.

Sold to chanel in 1994
Raisin blackberry prune blackcurrant oak chocolate smoke game earth coffee toffee
Dry power big bodied medium+ tannin medium acidity body alcohol medium+ intensity medium length
Still have quite some years of potential

2nd wine of the night @ Opus.  Beautiful aromatic nose of black cherry, blackberry, cassis, and mint. The mouthfeel is elegant & luxurious- silk glove.  A delicious palate of black cherry, cassis, mint, thyme, and chocolate. The tannins have softened beautifully.  This is the perfect drinking window.  A real treat.   Paired well with rack of lamb.  4.4‚≠ê

Wow! This is a bottle to keep. Drinkable got another 2-3 years, maybe even more. Brilliant nose after decantering for more than 30 days. Deep complex notes of black blackberry with high tannins. Leaves a long lasting impression after the last sip

Med garnet, stewed tea, black cherry, tobacco, cedar, ripe blackcurrant and black plum, some earth and game, licorice, herbal, full body, high grippy tannin, med+ balanced acidity, med+ intensity, med+ finish.

Surprisingly huge nutty nose with hazelnut; walnut, some caramel; sea salt, hay, very big, but big on mulberry;  a bit of fig. Some barnyard and hay. Mulberry nose, more fig, nuts, cheese: big surprise but god I love it

Deep ruby. Intense colour. 
Nose: cassis, ripe red plum, raspberry, oak, licorice, violet. 
After some time new flavours emerge: maraschino cherry, vanilla, cooked blackberry jam
Smooth tannins. 
Already mature. 
Definitely a Margaux, Left Bank

Another young gun from our local shop. Prepairing sole with lemongrass jus and risotto. Camping and cooking is great üëç. 
Leathery fruit cocktail with mild spices. This is my first Rauzan and I have to confess: This is a great producer! 
Mild tannins speak for themselves. Carefully crafted harvest I suppose. Nearly ready ‚Ä¶. just kidding‚Ä¶. Give it another 5-10 years and you will be in BDX Heaven. Absolutely recommendable. 4,3
Buy some if you can.
Cheers from Southern France

This wine is very elegant, smooth, and balanced, with higher freshness and acidity than I had initially expected. Very crisp, and lighter than I thought it would be. Medium body, velvety texture, medium high tannins (but polished) and medium high acidity. In the mouth, it almost feels like a Barolo! Good length also. Plum, black cherry, blackberry, sweet tobacco, leather, cigar box, pencil lead, with a hint pf chocolate at the end. Great complexity and very easy to drink l. In sum, excellent!

Earthy nose. Palate of sous-bois, mushrooms, and leather. Very elegant although starting to lose some power and body at 21 years. Decanted through aerator, but it probably needed more time to fully come back to life.

A very nice Margaux, well balanced. Needs a bit of time to open so decant (1h). I liked it very much, love the dryness and the complexity.
4,6/5

What a lucious floral inky perfumed Margaux. Time has certainly been good here. When we tasted this in 2006 it was big, bold and punchy. Now it is big, bold and just slaps you. The oak is front as a fresh earth, forest floor woodsmoke lingers. Big perfumed notes of violets and a mouth of blackberry, cassis, and plum with toasted spice and pipe tobacco. A delightful Margaux. Can't wait to revisit in 5 years. 94/100

A 26-year old Margaux that is very well aged and yet feeling still young with more potential.

Elegant and smooth on the palate with a vibrant nose of oak, cedar and chocolate. Air it for about an hour and the nose further offer aromas of vanilla and tobacco.

Opened to celebrate the return of the Premier League and this or City didn‚Äôt disappoint. I had the 2000 previously and this was as good as I remember that. Amazing structure with oak to start before black fruits and a smooth earthy finish. Absolutely top class. üê∫ score 9/10.

A beautiful Margaux indeed. The nose gave away the woodiness of this wine, which was confirmed with tasting. Besides the wood, the nose presented a beautiful Bordeaux bouquet. Palate was silky smooth, balanced on ripen fruit and wood. Butter was distinctly absent, but who cares? LOL. A wonderful wine overall. Try it if you have not!

Opens with rich black tea, violet perfume, and muted black fruit. After 4 hours, tobacco dominates. Ripe blackberry, black cherry, bramble, lavender, with the slightest cedar. Acid is seamless and balanced beautifully. This truly is a beautiful bottle.

On DFDS Seaways August 9:
Rauzan-Segl√° vintage 2008 Grand Cru Classe 100% Cabernet Sauvignon Margaux wine. First impression and note is a heavy cellar note, then wet forest, mushrooms and nice black currant and blackberries notes. After a while the cedar and tobacco is coming and despite the age of more than 12 years now, the wine also appears fresh and fruity and a lot of energy for the future. Drink or keep .... Difficult to say .... I would probably do both if I had more bottles.

Nothing really on the nose. No barnyard like Paulliac.   Instead a more full fruity tobacco style.  Tasted best about an hour after opening and drinking at room temp.  After two hours the acidity starts to perk up.

Drinking at peak... This bottle... Nothing sharp all finesse... Has aged really gracefully... All the classic hallmarks of a great old school Margaux. The declared alcohol is 12.5%! That's less than most Chardonnay people drink!!
On the nose the first thing that pops up is old cigar box... The red and blue fruit are all there but muted but not in a bad way... Violet flowers and early balsamic elements.
This is a wine you have a conversation with first and then order a juicy steak. Stunner.
True ballerina.

2010 Bordeaux mini horizontal tasting. In general, 2010s are still too young to open now, some bottles present elegant and balanced notes, but most are still sleeping with restrained flavours.
Immediately delivers pungent green bell pepper when poured into the glass, gradually unfolds plum, ripe cherry, blueberry, violet, vanilla, integrated oak and soft licorice and tobacco.
Bright acidity, fine grained tannins, flavorful and balanced, with cigar, graphite and tar lingering in the finish.

Perhaps the best showing Rauzan-Segla I have had at 21 years of age. 2001 has been an underrated vintage from my view, and one that deserves more attention. Classic and expressive Rauzan-Segla nose of ripen blackberry, violet and rosewood. Sexy, seductive and nearly flamboyant. Palate also lives up my expectations with elegant and soft entry, fully integrated tannin. Succulent and relatively long finish which gracefully disappears from stage. Let‚Äôs give it another shot in 5 years‚Äô time.

I love Rauzan-Segla! What a beautiful wine with a beautiful label. 

Deep ruby. Nose is pronounced with lots of blackcurrant, mocha, cinnamon, black plum, cedar, licioroce, old library leather, pencil shavings, perfume with violet. Palate more black fruit and mocha. Ridiculously mellow. Dry, med+ acidity, body, tannins and alcohol. Just oozing with joy!

Chateau Rauzan-Segla 2006 Vintage
Sensual bouquet of black currants, deep sinewy tannins, underpinning a dense racy core. Finely grained tannins with excellent grip, palate of precision, ample iron and graphite propelling to the finish.

Decanted as the cork was broken and dropped into the bt. Color is still dark red, sweet nose of cedar, currant, floral and florest floor.  Lovely balance of acidity ad sweet fruits, tannin is still marginally dusty but helped keeping a proper left bank posture.  Good concentration and  lingering long finish.  Still have plenty of life ahead.

Super good. Excellent berry, and currant taste, with lots of cool floral taste/scent, and well structured. Really developed after a 45‚Äô decant, and was not nearly as good until that point. Wonderful with V‚Äôs incredible pasta dish and Marshall‚Äôs cheeses. A great wine to celebrate World Cabernet Sauvignon Day!!
Frankly, after the decant, was so good as to seem underrated for the price!!

Another beauty üòé

üëÉBlackberry, meat, smoke.

üëÖ Chestnut, leather, mushroom, raisin.

High alcohol. Long finish. Medium+ body, flavor intensity and acidity. Medium (smooth) tannins.
