oak tobacco cedar vanilla  blackcurrant blackberry cassis plum chocolate coffee leather everything are there, what more can you ask for üòÜüëå
13.5 abv

Margaux flowery nose, dark plum, Pair perfectly with aged orange roast duck, beautiful smooth tannin, subtle plum. Follow on tasting of 2000 vintage: very earthy elder flower nose, opens up mellow hint of cinnamon spice, acidity gives way to ripe mature plum, with hint licorice end. Long finish pair with cheese board.

4.4 This 2nd growth pre-teen is too young; needs years and decanting to open.  Rauzan-Segla was bought by the Wertheimer family of Chanel in 1994.  130 acres on the Cantenac plateau.  The winemaker was John Kolasa of Latour.  A highly-rated wine and vintage; light nose of black currant, blackberry, cassis, dark chocolate, tar, black licorice. Black fruit bomb!  Light acidity and medium, flavorful mouth-coating tannins.

I do love a bit of Rauzan-Segla, and I love the Karl Lagerfeld label.

üëÅ deep ruby. üëÉpronounced blackcurrant, blackberry, bramble, black cherry, violet, mint, dried herbs, pencil shavings, leather, cedar, mocha.

Dry. Med+ body, alcohol, acidity & tannins! üëÖ pronounced, black fruit & mocha focussed, with leather & cedar. Long finish.

This has evolved since I last had it. More mellow & smooth than I remember. Still fruit forward and youthful, but with a lovely harmonious balance. Yummy.

Opaque warm ruby with orange in disk in eye 
Nose: clove, citrus, leather, honey, tabaco 
Taste: licorice, dark chocolate, black currant 
Acidity- medium plus, medium alcohol, velvet tannins 
Hedonistic level - medium plus

Stunner! This was a magnum at Wickens Restaurant at Dunkeld (they have a 32,000 bottle wine cellar, highly recommend). Served with Venison it was a perfect match. Got lots of tobacco and vanilla notes and a long silky finish. 2006 of this to go at home!

The 2008 vintage often gets overlooked by critics because of the challenging weather.  However this vintage benefitted from a long growing season and long hang times.  I decanted for 2 hours. Notes of cedar, herbs, forest, menthol & red fruits on the nose.  I was amazed at how fresh and vibrant it tasted.  The tannins are starting to soften but this has life to keep for many more years.

2010 Left Bank 2nd Growth Bordeaux vintage of 60% Cab Sauv, 37% Merlot, 2% Cab Franc, 1% Petit Verdot in gravel/clay from Margaux, France. Fermented in stainless, malolactic in vat. Aged 18mos in 60% new French oak. 14% abv. Clear deep ruby. Complex nose of leather, oak, vanilla cola, black cherry, blueberry, dried herbs, violet. Great florality. Dry. Medium bodied, high acid. High grippy tannins that need 3-4hr decant. Moderate &  balanced oak. Long finish. Love this vintage, great mix of fruit + herbs

Very dark ruby robe, with some movement to brick on the rim. Moderately intense nose. Maybe needs time to open up as just opened. Dark black fruit, tobacco, paper and vanilla. Very full body, dry, with medium plus to high tannin and high acidity. Intense palate. Blackcurrant, blackberry, cassis, cedar, pepper, vanilla and cinnamon. Very very long finish of ripe blackcurrant, spice and pepper. Intense, complex, balanced. Excellent and easily 10-15 years plus to go I think.

Gorgeous Margaux. A little shy at first, but after airing it opens up into a thing of real beauty and elegance. Heady, fragrant, refined, and fruitier than one would usually expect. This has everything you want from a Margaux in spades. Thoroughly enjoyable.

Dark ruby color with a m+ beautiful perfume-like nose. Mostly black-fruit, blackberry, blueberry, cassis, licorice, vanilla, very fresh and delightful. Palate is elegant and well-balanced. Confirming dark juicy berry fruits and tobacco notes. M+ acidity keeping it alive after 14 years of age. Refined tannin, almost doesn‚Äôt feel it. M+ Long lingering fruitcake-like finish with hints of minerality. Yummy indeed!

This is a ‚Äòwhat the fuck wine‚Äô.

Nose: classic Margaux and should I say Bordeaux left bank aromas - pleasant, somewhat floral (but not too) fragrances with earth, mild plum and cherry carried by the floral aromas.

To the palate:  medium body, floral flavours, punchy cherry and red berries, some leather, semi-hard tannins and acidicity. Enjoy with food or without.
A wine with definite CHARACTER and complexity. Not recommended for the merlot enthusiast, but rather a wine that grows the more you sip on it.

A little earthy, typical Margaux. Oaky, nice aroma and bouquet, smooth medium bodied, elegant with long finished. A little tannic though at first probably still a bit young but got better after 30 mins. Truly deserved to be a second growth.

4.75. As close to perfection as a wine can get. Twenty years old and still good for probably another 10 years. Just slightly garnet. Dark plum, cassis, tobacco, leather and a hint of vanilla. Silky, smooth, perfectly balanced. 2000 is a momentous year in Bordeaux and this wine is a fine example.

HK 2017. A beautiful wine. Blackcurrant blackberry smoke and cedar on the nose. The palate was full of dark fruits cassis and smoke. The smooth tannins are part of a really well structured wine with length and depth.

2005 Bordeaux blind tasting! Big, powerful (and slightly pungent) earthy nose with hints of leather, manure, tobacco, crushed gravel. The nose takes you straight to the local zoo or a countryside farm, I'm not even kidding! On the palate, ripe cassis, red cherry, and mint. Polished and very clean on the finish. A very good wine in its own right (especially with its unique nose) but definitely not among the top in the flight - 4.4

What an excellent wine...at a price though! Although not a good vintage overall, Second Growth Chateaux Rauzan-S√©gla made the best out of it. Deep opaque ruby color with some core-rim variation (11 year old wine in its full maturity!). The perfect combination of multi-layer aromas intermingling earthy notes of forest floor, oakiness, saut√©ed veggie, resiny and sensation of being surrounded by nature in its entire beauty. You keep breathing and wanting more. High acidity and tannin, earthy flavors. Long life

RWC - session Bordeaux 1982-83, 12 oct 2017. Eye: standard Noble ruby with light cognac rim. Nose: black currant, a bit raspberry, blueberry, licorice. Palate: silky tannins, right citricity, light berry taste. Good. 4.3/5.0

Opened this for Christmas Eve dinner with family and friends. Dried dark fruit, blackberry, cherry, black currant, licorice, black truffles, green bell peppers, cigar box, and dried earth. Medium body, however it was a perfect time to open with dinner.

1982 Ch√¢teau Rauzan-S√©gla GCC. What a historic vintage! 1982 Rauzan-Segla was great at its complexity and bright fruits, nose of leather, licorice, cassis, coffee and iron. It turns so fast but It has a sweet-spot before it's on the downslope. Yes, 1982 is a great vintage. Tasted in 2016 Nov.

Cheers to Karl Lagerfeld who designed the  label (and died unfortunately last month). 
Excellent vintage - excellent wine. Colour: dark purple with violet-red edges; nose: massive red fruit with vanilla sauce, plum, black currant, dark cherry, tobacco and hints of leather; palate: mouthfilling fruit, elegant phantom sweetness, cooled black currant juice running down the throat, nice tongue pressure, but silky tannins and decent presence of alcohol; Great stuff!

Very vibrant bottle. Tertiary showing well but not overshadowing the fruit. Elegant, firm, lots of finesse. Glad this one showed well. Cedar wood, tobacco, cigar, bacon, rustic. Cranberry, cherry, red fruit. Classic Margaux.

Had this with the Ch√¢teau promoter last night at Est. The nice label is to celebrate the Ch√¢teau‚Äòs 150th birthday. 
2009 was a warm year. This is really showing well early in its life. Beautiful balance and structure.

An elevated glass of wine, born for a great dinner party with no compromises.  This velvety intense wine is delicious now but will most certainly get better and better.  This is a fun wine for wine friends and neophytes alike.  This would make anyone want to move to France. üá´üá∑

Something new emerge on the second and third sniff. Perfume, oak, dried lavender and vanilla.  A bit flat on the palate initially but wakes up fully after 1 hour. Not dry anymore, with cocktail of fruits and subtle herbs: blueberries, fig.  Well balance but actively stimmulating. Many layers. Long, enjoyable astringency. 
With David Q.

My third and last bottle. This is my favorite Margaux producer. Dark crimson color. Open up in just a few minutes in a decanter. Smooth, elegant and matured. Not much nose. Blueberry and blackcurrant. Not so high acidity. Dry and Medium finish. Used to give it a 5-star but after comparing to those great Italian Tuscany‚Äôs that I recently had, a 4.5 would be a more accurate evaluation. To me, the French Bordeaux is losing ground. Go, Tuscany!

In the beginning a bit constrained but as it opened it came out with these beautiful floral notes  that so define the best of Margaux 
Accompanied with notes of leather , tobacco and subtle mocha this wine delivered a beautiful clean finish with a slightly saline undertone . Outstanding and made me feel a bit sexy - same effect Chanel N 5 has on women .... guess it‚Äôs because Chanel are the owners of this outstanding winery ü§ó

Top wine of the night. Nice dark red color. Oak and berries fragrance. Ripe raspberry, bluberry and spice on the tongue. Medium tannins with a nice medium long velvety finish. Nothing else needs to be said about this winen just savour it!

CG Chan's. Wow!
Subdued initially, then after an hour, voluptuous fragrant bouquet of sweetish wood polish, lavender, blackcurrant, blueberries, cedar and vanilla erupts. 

Full bodied yet silky smooth tannins. Lush concentrated layers of chocolate, smoke leather & varnish in rich crunchy mouthfeel, toward a luscious endpalate. 

4.4‚òÜ very good! Powerful vintage, needs aeration, best drunk with x2 decanting, 1-3h. Can cellar another 10-20yrs.

Dinner @Maiale Japanese-Italian restaurant, Ipoh. 05.06.2019

Clear, Intense dark opaque core, fading to an abrupt ruby rim with hints of violate, still very youthful. Clean, intense dark cherry, cassis, mild toasty / spicy notes, subtle walnut and floral aromas (perfumed). Dry, moderate + acidity, well integrated fine tannins. Dark fruits, oak spice, full body, integrated alcohol, long finish, very dry, needs time: 7-10+ years.

Difficult, challenging, proud, shy, not exactly what a sommelier would have said or recommended, nonetheless a wine that survive and prosper over some of the most impossible eras, oak, and more intense than any Lynch Bage, only better.

Lovely wine.  I get some crunchy fruit possible blueberries blackberries and raspberry.  Quite woody and a bit of leather with some underlying white peeper.  Could still mature as tannin still holding up well.

A very sensual and elaborated nose starting with cherries, evolving to earthy notes with refined Louis Vuitton leather, mature fruit and asparagus. A beautiful, powerful and silky structure supported by a refreshing acidity, medium + tannins and flavors of cherries, oak, and very dark chocolate. Would cellar for another 5 years to rate it a 5 star.

Cigar box, smoke, blackberry, black pepper, black licorice, and earthy nose. Medium tannins. Medium high acidity. Medium body. Cranberry, cedar, eucalyptus, earthy underbrush, mushroom, leather, blueberry, and blackcurrant. Balanced fruit and savory - a good time to drink!!! 4.7‚≠êÔ∏è

2nd growth. Apparently Thomas Jefferson loves this wine and bought it on some routine.

Ein Mix aus Schwarze Johannisbeere, Brombeere, etwas Holunder, Orangenschale als Fruchtkomponenten. Dann Flieder, Schokominze, Wacholderbeeren, Pfeffer, etwas Zedernholz, auch erdige und kr√§utrige Kompetenten. Langer Nachhall in der Nase von k√ºhlen/frischen vegetativen Noten. 

Der Wein ist klar gezeichnet. Von allem etwas aber nicht zu viel dabei.

Am Gaumen samtig und zugleich sehr komplex, mittlere S√§ure, viel Tannin, wunderbar trockener Abgang. 

Heute 93-94++ Punkte. Eventuell mal 96+.

This was great and with another 5-10 in the bottle it will shed some more baby fat and surely be a 5 star wine. At this stage I would have guessed this was a Napa Cabernet. A dark purple in the glass. Dark chocolate, bruised or baked tart fruit (red and black), crushed slate, dusty/gravel aromas, clove, and dried baking spices on the nose. Full bodied, medium plus acidity, and gritty tannins.

Very nice 20 yrs Brodeaux! Aroma of cassis, blackberry,  blackcurrant, cedar, oak with licorice undertone. Bold, high acidity with elegant and silky tannin. On the palate notes of black fruit, black currant, mushroom, wet wood with tobacco and pencil shaving finishing

Had this wine served at cold temperature and it needed to warm up a little before the classic fragrant of Boudreaux blend exude. The fruits started emerge and well balanced and rounded. Should have this warm up a lot more before drinking them

I was surprised of the complexity in fruit, smoke and wood. Margaux from its finest side, with smooth, but still an edge in the texture. Served to wild duck and other dark meat is a mix not to discuss

Wow... a tough one to call. 4.75 for sure but was almost inclined to give it a 5. Silky smooth but yet with a lot of oomph. Full body, lots of earthy notes, fruity, black and red. Extremely layered, lots of finesse. Robert Parker calls it sensual and that‚Äôs just what this beauty is. I agree maybe another 5 years on this bottle would be insane if not even more but totally approachable now. Go get it!!

A lot of funk on this one, probably due to the age or integrated complexity of this one. I got a lot of Cassis and cherry fruitiness, french chocolatey oak and a tinge of leather. Palate was still funky fruity with refined tannins, and medium+ finish. What a treat @[1|50282791|Graham Ng]

Ruby, pinkish-orange rim.Nose:cassis, blackberry,leather,leaf litter.Palate:black and red fruit,graphite,damp earth,tobacco leaf.Super smooth mouthfeel,balanced acidity,well integrated,medium bodied,medium-long finish, accessible and enjoyable.Consumed with roasted rolled loin of pork.Decanted for 30 minutes, then consumed over 1.5 hours. Aug 15

A second go at this beautiful 1996 vintage rauzan & it did not disappoint. Rich and complex, just as I remembered it to be, with classic characteristics of an aged Margaux. Earthy notes lead on the nose, followed by perfume, oak and black fruits. On the palate, well-integrated flavors of plum, vanilla, cassis and leather that reaffirmed the elegance of this bottle.

Garnet brownish in color. Damp wet forest floor nose of Mushroom and Black cherry with traces of Oak. Drinking Fabulous at 19 years old. Silky soft tannins. Smooth easy flavors of Leather, black cherry. 54% CS, 40% Merlot, 5% PC and 1% CF.

Dull garnet in color. 2and growth Bordeauz. Nose of tobacco, leather, mushroom, wet earth, underbrush.  One of Thomas Jeffersons favorite wines. Silky soft tannins.54%CS/40%Merlot/5%PV and 1% CF. Favorite of the class. Smooth tannins with nice acidity.

Overall 4.3 @ Praelum: Appearance is clear deep purple. Smell is pronounced with aromas of dark fruit, chocolate and oak. Taste is dry, medium acidity, medium tannins and full bodied with long finish.

Rubinr√∏d
Herlig aroma av sigar, m√∏rk s√∏t frukt, nydelig  cassis. Rosiner, t√∏rket m√∏rk frukt.
Bl√∏te integrerte tanniner, blackcurrant leather tobacco blackberry plum vanilla cherry chocolate coffee blueberry pepper 
92p

Finewines.sg tasting.
Outstanding complexity

Rich ruby colour. This has multi layers of notes, starting from the funky barnyard, leather. Prominent mint integrated with preserved plum, raspberry, giving off a nice aroma of mint fruit tea.

Going deeper I also get toasted coconut, chocolate and orange peel. 

Finish is long, very pleasant and balanced.

Beautiful example of a left bank Bordeaux, incredibly high typicity showing Margaux. Florals in terms of violet and dark red, black and purple blossoms dominating followed by a gravel minerality. This is not a fruit driven Bordeaux but very finely balanced and delicate.

Very good wine. Need to be decanted at least for 3 hours to get the best out of it. Blackberry, leather and spicey smell. Delicate and refined flavor with predominance of wild forest fruits well balaced and lingering finish

Phenomenal wine. Absolutely worth it. Let it open up for a few hours.
Beautiful. Smooth tannins, lots of forest floor with oak and black fruit backing it up.

2013 vintage. Elegant, silky and gentle wine. Hints of summer fruits, strawberries, cherries on the nose. On the palette, fine tannins with oak, tobacco, cherries, blackcurrents and distinct minerality. Medium to long finish. Decent.

Ruby violet in color; floral, fresh red berries, herbal aromas. Powerful, well structured

Earthy driven wine with huge potential to age üòã

3.9. Vibrant and young Margaux. Young but so approachable at the same time. Vibrant red fruits and black currant. Offset by leathery notes, pencil shavings and gripping structure. Pleasant tannins. Clearly something to store for years to come. Not cheap but hey :-)

Beautiful ruby color. The nose holds sour cherry components with leather, plum, raspberry and cranberry. Blackberry and sour cherry dominate the palate; smoke and peppery finish.  Extremely fresh with nice supple tannins. A nice wine.

Before decanting, cherry and dark fruit. After decanting, blackberry, black current, forest floor and vibrant mushroom notes. Fantastic tannins. 2018 is drinking great now and looking forward to decades in the future.

54% Cab.Sauv, 41% Merlot, 4% Petit Verdot, 1% Cab.Franc

double-decanted; deep plum hue w/red rim; deeply smokey tobacco, floral violette like graphite, minerally restraint dark fruits w/dried herbs
nearly full-bodied of oaky entry, solid structure, vigorous mouthfeel & finish by herbal tannins w/slightly bitter after-taste
a good substantial btl of deeper style w/nice purity & precision, more thoughtfully brooding gravitas than elegance

could turned to be a rustically earthy btl for further 5-8 yrs aging

An impressive Margaux. Touch of would and bouquet of ripe fruit. Smokey, warm tones of berries, cherry, a soft tone of oak, licorice, espresso and leather. Thick and layered, with an outstanding complexity. Very good, and will only get better

A cracking claret despite not the best vintage. Plumy, black cherry, blackcurrant, some game and leather, with hints of floral note all well integrated and balanced. Lovely smooth in mouth. Long delicious finish. 

A blend of 52.5% Cabernet Sauvignon, 42% Merlot, 4% Petit Verdot, 1.5% Cabernet Franc. Maybe this is the key to quality claret..

Slight brick rim. Pronounced mix of tobacco, camphor, graphite, dusty oak and herbal. Smooth and silky with enough acidity and bitterness in the finish.

Even if the dress is a bit evolved, this wine is still very alive after almost 30 years. I thought it was a 2006 at first... 

Memorable pairing with MPB‚Äôs perfectly cooked lamb üôèüèªüç∑

3.75 rounded up.

Big big nose, what a great margaux!
Floral smokiness that you can't get tired of. Fruity berries with a hint of eucalyptus and vanilla. Long palate with tobacco finish with the silky tanning. Must have a couple in the cellar

This was the wine of the night and a great example of one of those dangerous libations that can start an addictive habit of wanting to only drink older Bordeaux. It‚Äôs not so easy to still find wines from the 80s that are still performing this well. So Bravo! Enticing notes of truffle with forest floor, saline minerality and sweet tobacco with plenty of dried red cherries to flesh it all out. It has a graceful presence with finely-sculpted tannins along an extraordinarily long finish.

Absolutely amazing. Full of vanilla and truffle with medium aromas in general. Some oak, and a nose that is beyond charming and a body with not tannins with a long and complex medium tannic structure. Just the right time to drink it as well. A must have.

Eye: Medium garnet

Nose:  Medium+ intensity. Of course oak and vanilla are here. It's also full off red and black fresh fruits. Blackcurrant, blackberry, cherry, raspberry. 

Mouth: Dry. Medium tannins, high acidity and alcohol. Medium+  intensity on the palate and medium+ finish.

It's a great wine, very well balanced, but the acidity is overwhelming the palate.

2015 Chateau Rauzan-Segla, Margaux, France
Wonderful bouquet - lush red fruit dipped in anise. Perfectly balanced tannin with boysenberry, leather, and the one of a kind terroir! Still drinking beautifully in June of 2021.
Lovely Margaux if slightly youthful still, bouquet a delight and of course faultless to my palate. But still seemed somehow like it could get better with a little more age ...
Old world - earthy with smoke oak and tobacco both on the nose and palate.  More blackberry on the palate, with a medium long finish.  It was good but I bought 2 to see how it is in a few years
This was tough to rate properly, I had very high expectations at $100usd, lots of reviews, maybe a slightly off vintage based on ratings? Fine wine but pretty ‚Äòbasic‚Äô for a high ranked Margaux
Super impressive! Very forgiving considering the young age. Warm, long, oaky and above all smooth. I'm sure the -09 will get better with time, but honestly this is in a good spot already!

Pleasant old-fashioned smell, with some woody flavour. Very balanced tannin and body. Ripe grapes, with verry little sour berries. 
It was a pity that I could not enjoy it in a longer period. Maybe next time.

My third Rauzan-Segla and a ‚Äò96 again. I now understand what graphite is with reference to the taste of this wonderful wine. At 22 years old, the fruits are still strong but in a good way. Bordeaux is the gold standard in wine making, for a reason.

Tried this wine for the second time. A solid Margaux and unmistakably Bordeaux. Ageing has really done well on this one. Breathing opens it up greatly. Tobacco leaves, armchair leather, grilled tomatoes, roasted Ethiopian coffee beans and dark chocolates this time round. Smooth edges, vanilla finish.
Aug 2019/home / pork ribs /nachos/ blackcurrant oak vanilla blackcurrant plum black fruit blackberry cherry dried flowers walnut baked apple butter vanilla
This is a great Margaux. Perfectly ready to drink now. Dark berries and enough tannins to keep it interesting.
Excellent wine. Very smooth confident with great body and a taste of wood and smooth aromas and great on the tongue
Well-structured and perfumed. Blackberry and currants with dried herb, cloves and foresty notes. Tasted in October 2015.
Best of our left bank tasting - wonderful elegance and dryness... redder fruit, strawberry but in a good way...
Beautiful perfume and rose petal florality with cassis, leather and cedar notes. Indian tea with a long rounded finish. Wow.

One of the better Margaux. Fantastic for a 30 year old bottle. Still fruit and juicy....
Soft and good finish

Showing beautifully at age 18!
Still retaining fresh fruit and tannin-- all impressed.  Underrated value of Margaux!!
Excellent Margaux. Light notes of red berries in the glas. The taste is spicy, tobacco and ripe plums.
Great wine. Nice sophisticated nose, long after taste. Smooth tannines bit thin since its 2007. Tasted again, great.
WOTN ! Great nose and palate that evolves through the nite. Balanced, smooth, elegant with earthy nose
Excellent, tannic but not to much so well balanced and a perfect match for my steak with au poivre sauce!
This is an outstanding bottle of wine.  So well balanced and soft as it caresses the throat.  Deep aged fruit.  Yummy
Magical after 1.5/2 hours open. Smooth subtle and satin on the palate light on the nose. Round fruit like light blueberry.
Very aromatic, leather, violet, earthy, black fruit, silky, tobacco, mineral, toasty, very nice to drink now
Balanced nose with notes of wood, volume and dark berries on the palet. Grat experience. Worth wile waiting 20 years.
This bottle now becomes hard to find.  Solid Marhaux from an excellent Chateau.  Great tannin and mineral balance.

Good balance of fruit and tannins. Great nose of black currant, savoury meat, forest floor and tobacco. Smoky, toasty wood character with berry fruit. Well structured with a juicy finish.

Very elegant and round. A typical Margaux. Deep Ruby color. M+ nose of blackcurrant, tobacco, liquorice and vanilla. M+ acidity, H alcohol, M+ and soft tannins, M+ body. M+ palate and M+ finish.
Powerful espresso and coffee grind nose.  Coffee bean, black licorice, touch of blackberry.  Medium bodied.  Nicely structured.  Would like to try this again when it's 10-12 years old.
Good value Margaux in a very balanced style. Nice notes of vanilla, flowers, cedar, white pepper -- but not too aggressive with any one flavor. Drinks nicely right after opening.
Brilliant - long fruit nose with hints of minerals, touch of leather. In the mouth goes on for ever. Beautiful balance, red fruit  with touch of rose and balanced against stone and tobacco.
Wafts of dark berry, mineral and floral  aromas followed with old world goodness full of anise, eucalyptus,  blackberry, dark silky fruit and tight tannins with a very long finish.   Delicious.
Clear ruby red, woody nose, black currants, black berries, dried leaves. Needs time to open, which gives more cedar wood, cigar and hint of cinnamon. Mellow soft tannins and smooth aftertaste.

On the nose leather, cassis and black fruit.

On the palate very elegant, soft tannins with balanced minerality.
On the lighter side, not a ton of depth but a really nice and smooth finish. Quite dry, menthol, pepper, leather, blackberries, tobacco.
4+ Black fruit palate with tobacco and leather notes and oaky hints. Good, balanced structure with an elegant and smooth finish.
Margaux‚Äôs one can drink now.  Good nose.  I like touch of minerals, oak, blend with good acidity and fine tannin. Good finish too.

company dinner. very nice Bordeaux. plum cherry leather palate. medium acidity. very nice finish. structured and integrated tannin.

Took almost 2 hours for this to open up but ended up being very drinkable. Either past prime or in a little dead period. Wait a bit.
Very deep flavors with just a little specific oak wood smells. And complex taste. I like this Margaux wine organized by chanel.
Dark fruits, violets and leather on the nose. This opened beautifully. We were a bit greedy but by the end it was showing all of its Margaux glory.
Very pleasant, it had the bright red and sweet fruit of 1990. Fully resolved tannins that melted in your mouth, probably on the gentle downslope.
Lovely Margaux. (91) Velvety tannins, red fruits-nuanced bouquet of aromas, tobacco. Decanted for 1 hour: perfect aging, smooth.
Autumn leaves , leather, black pepper cassis and violets. Still enough freshness and life at 18Y of age and refreshing acidity
Very soft, noticeable sulfur, cooked vegetables, red fruit, touch of ethanol, lighter alcohol. Shows the age, can‚Äôt last much longer.
Soft and round mouthfeel...incredible! Soft blackberry and violet notes. Fragrant lavender and cherry cola nose...very tasty!
Needed some airing despite its vintage, went from very average to quite exceptional, short drinking window after airing, very elegant finesse
Welcome back to HK Charlie. Classic Margaux. Could have done with being left to open up but this was super. Went well with our Peking Duck!
Made up for average 98 bottle. However only 4 stars as I felt the 81 cos still trumped with higher complexity and more dimensions.
Beautiful baby powder floral bouquet, lots going on for the palate - cherry blackcurrants chocolate oak. Silky, exquisite, highly enjoyable!
Found this in a colleagues wine stash.. After working with derivatives trading for 20 years, he is soo rich he won't miss it.
Still drinking nicely, despite the age. Perhaps a little thin now and lighter than before, but still well structured. A real treat.
Sehr wohl schmeckender roter mit Vanille und Karamellnoten.
equilibratissimo, fruttato e floreale. In bocca √® fresco e con una mineralit√† spiccata. Buonissimo.

Had all the delicious characteristics of a 31 year old wine but without dominating the palette, surprisingly vibrant and youthful. Up there with the very best I‚Äôve ever tasted, exceptional!
Beautiful wood on the nose. It lingers after breathing for a while. Brilliant choice for accompanying intelligent dialogue.
Blackcurrant, red berries, oak and leather. Soft tannins - balanced acitity. Smooth and tasty finish. Drink now

This vineyard continues to impress ... Had this in the Singapore Airlines first class lounge with medium expectations and it was a WOW.  Oak and raspberry on the nose, a bit of leather and chocolate on the palate, and overall, just a kick ass Margaux...

Performed less than the Poyferre 2011. And need more time to be opened. However, when the wine was opened, you can tell that this is a classic Margaux. Lovely, elegant, medium+ bodied. The nose showed mild sweet black fruit, leather cedar. Nice wine.

I was initially skeptical about the provenance of this particular bottle but any doubt cast was soon overcome. 

Like a prima ballerina, the wine was poised with precision, displaying purity of fruit and perfume that‚Äôs oh-so-characteristic of Margaux. 

A dazzling display of cherry, plum, cloves, sweet tobacco and violets, all of which was complemented by a layer of polished tannins. 

Graceful and sensuous, this wine had unmatched levels of elegance. A remarkable expression of a classic claret. 

93/100

This one shows the most concentration among the wines in the vertical. Primary fruit. Floral notes. Chocolate. Baking spice. A hint of green-ness. Balanced on palate. Moderate ripe fruit profile. Still young. Quite modern in style.

Tasted side by side with Napanook. Which shows off Margaux being the feminine side of Bordeaux. The body is a little lighter compared to the Napanook which mean a added dimension of elegance with Napanook being more fleshy bodied.
Seductive lady. She‚Äôll make you beg for her love.

Chateau Rauzan-Segla tasting at wine shop Enoteca.  Blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Merlot.
Garnet color.  Nose of floral, blackcurrant, mint &  leather.  Well integrated, medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a fruity finish,
soft, elegant palate, lacks substance but very enjoyable nonetheless.  Should finish it within five years.

The wine was completely shutdown at first, gradually opened up after decanted for over 3 hours. It revealed sweet smells of almonds and graphite. Silky body. Still some tannins at the moment but the fruit begin to subside. My gut feeling tells me a beautiful wine is in the making. Very promising.

Boxing Day beauties start with this wonderful Margaux!
Delightful and earthy notes - cherries & cassis with brambles & hints of stewed & red fruits. Beautiful background of earthiness, cedar and spice with subtle meaty notes with hints of cocoa and air cured tobacco.
Great flavour profile and amplitude - blackcurrants and cherry wrapped around earthy and woodiness coming through on the palate with lingering finish.
Dry, med+ body, med acidity and soft grippy tannins.
Overall, start to finish ‚úÖing üì¶‚Äòs! 4.8üåü

Grand cru class√© tasting at Max. I know this is one of the weaker vintages, but for me this is stunning! 62% Cab.Sauv, 36% Merlot, 2% and Petit Verdot. One of the most natural aromas I have ever smelled. Scents of dark berries, dried flowers. mushrooms and mossy forrest. Elegant palate with minerals, cr√®me de cassis and cherries. Great balance. Fine grained tanins. The finish is smooth like velvet. This most definately have some potential. Very good early signs atleast. I would love to back and try later.

Side by side 2006 Bordeaux 2nd growth comparo. Cos and Rauzan Segla.

Not much of a comparison as the Cos was corked. But this was a nice one, integrated tannins, had that graphite thing, cedar, dark cherry and plum, savory finish. Happy this travelled all right from Singapore to the US to share.

Ruby red, clear, mid rim with very little garnet

Plum, ripe red cherry, vanilla, bold, leather, slight forest floor, black currant 

Dry, grippy tannin, fruity entry, elegant, good acid and long length 

Very nice grand cru Classe.

Good Margaux, though expected more than 4 from this one.
Color is beautiful dark garnet with a rust edge.
Nose of red cherry jam and earth.
On the palate red berry, mocha, leather and truffle notes. All on a lighter side.
Medium bodied with a bit grainy tannins.
Not sure if it would improve with aging‚Ä¶.
Medium+ finish.

40% merlot, 54% cab sauv, 5% petit verdot, 1% cab franc. 50 % new barels. restrained and structured. Bell pepper, the palate I expected to be more intense with initially smooth round tannins that linger with a firm grip, still good acid. Ages faster than I expected. Complex but xould be more intense with a better length

Tasting the 2010/2011 vintage.

This 2011 vintage is more accessible structures and fruitiness than 2010. Medium ruby red, medium to full- bodied, black fruits flavors, berries, plum, tobacco, cassis and mint. Long with refined tannins .

The wine is in deep garnet colour, it has medium+ nose intensity. It comes with aromas of cassis, blackberry, some coffee and leather. The wine is  with medium acidity, medium tannins, medium alcohol, and medium+ body. It has a  intensity and a medium finish. It comes with flavours of black cherry, black raspberry, cassis. Overall the wine offers roundness and velvety tannins! This wine is good!

RP90+
Deep garnet in color, the 2008 Rauzan-S√©gla has a rather rustic nose of sweaty leather, tobacco and dried herbs over a core of dried mulberries, prunes and underbrush. Medium-bodied, the mid-palate has just enough earthy/savory flavors with chewy tannins and a drying finish.
By RP advoate

Sorry folks just a simple notes as I was too overwhelmed üòÖ & overloaded from yesterday session

270822 Thanks to Bro @SKT for hosting a great session of 11btls (Theme: 2000 - 2009) at his home with amazing food & obviously the wines with @Julian Si @Eddie Cheah @Kaki Vino , WMK, CKS , MC, TCThe session lasted 7 hrs with laughters & Joy. 

TC‚Äôs btl. Ripe black fruit, earthy, oak spice. Rounded & savory with good finished . Would love it more if overall structure integrated.

High in alcohol. I found it immediately in the nose and the long legs almost masking the beauty of this elegant wine. Red fruit-driven but I find a slight hint of tropical fruit in the mouth. I bet the Petit Verdot does it.

Uncorked at the righ time. Very pleasant floral nose, dark fruit with hints of mint, very well integrated, tannin was rounded, structure was tight, balanced  acidity that carried a medium finish. A respectable Margaux, not spectacular. Paired nicely a slowly cooked osobucco.

Vintage 2000
Tasted Jan22

Coming from a legendary vintage, this wine certainly has a lot of future. However with 21y of age, drinks amazingly at the moment. While a bit closed at the beginning, it delivered an amazingly elegant result with layers of ripe red and black fruits, spices, floral notes, cigar box, tobacco, coffee, herbs and a great structure in perfect balance. Long finish. Such an elegant wine!

Margaux is my favourite of the Bordeaux appellations (the perfume does it) ... There are many fantastic classified and unclassified offerings to fit all budgets as I'm discovering... What I can't fathom is why the 2CC offerings from Rauzan are so competitively priced.  They're great,  great value and come with a fine pedigree... This could do with more time,  and it's not the greatest vintage, but it will still be a treat for anyone over the next decade.

Nose in full of meaty, leather elements, also expressed a lot of floral characters, which is more on dried flowers. In mouth, tannin is soft and lively acid made this a medium to full body wine. The aftertaste is full of floral fragrance , like Chinese "5 Flower tea". I want to have it in my cellar and enjoy it in the coming 10 years

inky color, superb well developed and maturing nose, mineral, smoky, inky, red fruit and on the second day truffles on the nose. Full, supple, silky tannins and flavors that linger long. superb wine. to buy

1981 Cabernet Sauvignon, medium brown reddish.
Medium nose of fullripe black fruit, berry, cassis, blackberry, earth, mushroom, forest floor, wet leaves, coffee, medicinal, tar, hint of jodium.
Dry, medium acidity & tannins, medium- other notes, still retains her fruit, velvety palate and long finish.
This is such a privilege, thankful for my wine friend @[1|11633561|Steef Duinhouwer] giving us such a fantastic experience üôè‚ú®
Lots of red berries, floral, ultra silky tannins and a long, long finish. Great wine.

Lovely fresh and lively flavours of dark berries, violets, caramel. Deep dark ruby. Easy sipping, med bodied, red and dark berries, gentle tannins, earth and leather, red liquorice, mocha, long fruit finish. Lovely and will get better in years to come...

This classified growth tends with great care to 52 hectares located in the heart of Margaux terroir. Subtle and rich, this great wine offers a generous bouquet and the assurance of an exceptional ageing potential.

My 1st Segla & despite the poor vintage this was great paired with rump of lamb. Opaque dark ruby red with gorgeous nose of plum, blackcurrant, violets, chocolate, smoky oak, leather & pencil box. Dry, medium+ acidity & body with smooth firm tannins. Lovely balance. Flavours of black fruits & plum with an almost creamy, silky mouthfeel. Long dry slightly spicy finish which lingers nicely. Yum! 4.1‚≠ê sounds about right to me Vivino.

Recency bias warning: this may well be my fav Margaux ever... it's been far too long.

At 13.5% ABV, it has balance like Simon Biles.

A divine 2nd growth Medoc.

Dark fruits like blackcurrant, black cherry, cassis and even slight bits of plum give way to leather, slight barbecue, cigar ash, cedar sticks, all the best elements of French oak at play in concert here.

On the nose all the way through the finish minutes later, this wine haunts you mercilessly in the most enchanting way.

Holy cow.

Superb dark ruby robe with brown disks. The nose offers a subtle balance of matured fruits (dried prune, blackberries, plum), morel, gentle oak, tobacco, and soil / heated chalk. When drinking, the wine is very smooth, opening with a moderate acidity and generous fruits, balanced by a rich terroir  "umami" (mushroom, soil and oak) with gentle spices in the end for a long finish. Excellent wine!

A beautiful red color with an orange rim. The bouquet is eminent with mature Bordeaux nuances of earth, leather a hint of coffee and smoke and dark berries. The taste is complex and elegant with dark berries, earth, licorice and leather. The finish is really long with delicate tannins and with all the different nuances conforming a pleasant memory. 
It is almost a year since last time but it is even better now! Five üåü
Because I am worth it

3.8 the issue is the price for what tastes more 2D than something more exquisite. Nose there‚Äôs this mild barnyard smell. On the palate get blackcurrants, plum, oak like tobacco, with a smooth finish.

The wine has a good smoke and oaky flavour at first and an elegant dark fruit and plum like finish. It has to air a bit to bring out the flavour profile. At first, the oaky flavour kind of overwhelm others.

Acquired by de Rauzan in 1661, manager of Ch√¢teau Margaux and Latour then, its wines having reached George Washington through Thomas Jefferson in 1816, through heirs to Chanel in 1994, it underwent massive reconstruction. 

54CS 40M 5PV 1 CF: 30 years vines; ideal conditions for the ripening of each variety. 

Sweet and fat, full bodied wine, with chewy tannins, polished mouthfeel, gradually building to a long graphite aftertaste; Currants, berries, violets and spices. 

Bordeaux Left Bank Blind Tasting 6:6

So fantastic.  The iron fist in a velvet glove, probably more velvet. Pronounced fruit, more forward then I'd expect for Bordeaux, balanced with smooth tannins. Balanced everything,  a mere description wont capture, try this if you can

92-93pts. Up in the air... And finally a great wine list. A very sexy and balanced Margaux. Grilled plum, blackberry and rosmarin infused cherry. Lovely sweetness and propper volume. A great value. On its way to best drinking window. Easily drinkable for the next 20 years.

Dark garnet, very fine nose like any fine bordeaux, good dash of creme de cassis, cigar box, tropical floral,  graphite, leather, teak. Medium to full, good acidity and body, fine tannin, good medium finish.

Ruby with a slight brownish tint. Blueberry, oak, leather, tobacco, menthol and black currant nose. White pepper and licorice coming through in the end. Clean, cool and in it‚Äôs perfect drinking window right now. Complex. Well balanced and long. Tannines present, but polished. Fantastic combo with a grilled entrecote.
Wow. Just wow. We cracked this 5L bottle and let it breathe baby breathe. And what a treat it was!

Great big nose packed with berries, cocoa and caramelised cherries. Deceptively light to taste. Tannins but not over powering. Youth comes through. This young man will mature into a true gent. Delicious.

Beautiful clarity of fruit with raspberries and currants on the nose. Roses and other flowers too. It's almost hard to describe, but there's a real purity. Full body, with fabulous balance and depth. It has everything in the right place.¬†

Precious and austere at the same time, its deep minerality appears after a while. Fruit as Ripe currant and black cherry, then sandalwood and tobacco leaf. Ripe and smooth tannin. Firm and long lasting supported by freshness. It will get better in next few years
Fantastic fruit lovely bouquet had it with a Japanese tasting menu it psittacosaurus amazing.it was all seafood sashimi. Superb

I have this friend and every time I bring up a meal we once had (he‚Äôs a raging old queen to tell you the truth) he feigns like he remembers and says (‚Äúdidn‚Äôt we have boiled arsehole? Yes I remember‚Äù)... well if it doesn‚Äôt put you off this wine is how I imagine that tastes, rich, succulent, fruity, earthy and utterly moreish...!

Dark purple with a dark ruby rim. Nose of dark fruit with cedar. In the mouth very smooth, still plenty of fruit with a aromatic cigar box, tannins very soft. Excellent delicate claret. Ready now no need to wait any longer.

Bon Bordeaux, fruits noirs bien pr√©sent, cassis, m√ªres et myrtille. Cuir, chocolat, vanille. Mineralit√© agr√©able. Mais le prix est trop haut.
Nice Bordeaux, black fruits really present, black currant, blackberry and blueberry. Leather, chocolate, vanilla. Mineral good as well.

Bought from Vivino online shop when it was on special discount.
Balanced, a little sweet in the mid palate but surprisingly matched with the clams I fried with local HK chilli + oyster sauce.

Wow few more years since my last tasting has  helped to evolve this Margaux with some velvety texture and complexity. Nose is so fragrant with dark fruit compote and earthy, leathery tones. Plush, luscious mouthfeel loaded with balanced flavours of blackcurrant, dark cherries, toasted coffee, tar, leathers, damp earth and sweet spices. Well integrated.

Beautiful colour still, deep ruby with a delicate garnet rim. Great acidity and integrated tannins yet missing a bit of  vibrancy so perhaps tipped over its peak.

Full of milk chocolate on the nose first revealing lots of leather with the first swirl. Followed by lots of dark plum and hints of cassis. 

Plum, cassis and chocolate on the palate. Cedar and leather finish.

On the glass, the wine shows a deep ruby core with minimal fading on the rim. At first, it only revealed a hint of truffles. The remainder required coaxing and time. Licorice, cassis, sage, oregano, vanilla, and caramel were some of the notes the wine offered throughout the evening. The palate was silky smooth with further layers of dark chocolate and coffee. This wine makes you travel, makes you feel time‚Äôs careful and violent effect on matter. And if you give it a few more years, it‚Äôll take you further.

Some air and the medium plus body comes with powerful aromas of blackberry, blackcurrant, menthol tabacco, pencil-shavings and barnyard in a strong tannin-backbon. Long finish and unexpectedly gripping, ready to drink!

I was worried that this might be getting to old, not the case. An amazing Bordeaux, lively with buckets of blackberries and a sting mineral noise, some anise. Some smoke.  A light mouthfeel that was pleasing and clean.  I think a. 60 to 90 min decant with this wine would be a good call.

The wine's smooth, complex texture will make you want to linger over the tasting experience. To taste a glass of Rauzan-S√©gla is to savour its fruity freshness and let yourself be transported by its silky smooth texture, the result of over 3 centuries of winemaking expertise.

Always love a good Margaux and this satisfies very well!  Very dark violet in color with aromas of leather, spice and smokiness.  Fry with good tannins.  Evident leather, cedar, oak, pencil shavings and spiciness.  Smooth and elegant.  Medium to full bodied.  Went very well with our steak.

Blueberries all day - on the nose and the palate. Austere at first, then opened up after about 2 hours in a decanter. Beautiful balance - moderate fruit, soft tannins, medium body, ample acid, long finish, not overly alcoholed. One of the best wines I drank this year.

Showing earth leather black currant pepper cheese tobacco and graphite.

Dark ruby with a garnet hue. Nose has subtle dark fruit (black cherry and blackcurrants) with slight tartness, green capsicum (bell pepper), clove, leather, dried herbs and white pepper. A lovely Margaux, opulent and modern in style but with good balance.  Medium body with a soft velvety palate.  Notes of rich dark chocolate, coffee with some meaty and tobacco undertones.  Nice structure too.  This 2008 is drinking very well at the moment

The 2007 Rauzan Segla Margaux Is a blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Merlot. It presents a medium body and layers of licorice, black fruits, leather and cherry. It is drinking well now and had several years ahead. A good but not excellent Rauzan.

Deep ruby.  Perfumed and aromatic, beautiful scents of fresh blackberry, eucalyptus, coconut, vanilla, tobacco, graphite, hint of gun powder.  M+ acidity, medium to M+ integrated tannin, M+ body.  M+ finish, aftertaste of cassis, blueberry, bay leaf, charcoal.  Well structured and balanced.  A wine for ageing.  Lovely now, but will definitely improve further with time.  20 April 2020.

Some of the finest Margaux I have ever tasted !
I am a big Margaux fan... the 1985 Ch Margaux remains one of my all-time favorites in not-so-old vintages. This Rauzan-S√©gla impressed me. Served blind like all other wines of that night, typical Margaux notes but a youth that made be think of a 1990. Such a treat, a wine I adore in one of my favorite vintages. 14 years since 2005!  Seems like yesterday, we were all scrambling to get 2005 Bordeaux futures; The best since 2000.  Of course, back to back epic 2009 & 2010 vintages later on diminished all the epic-ness.  In my opinion, this is one of the best high end value bottles ever produced. Delicious. Multiple layers of flavour, from dark fruit (plum and and black cherry) moving to subtle chocolate, coffee and a hint of tobacco. Strong legs. Brick red colour. Great with red meat - venison stew in our case.

Deep cigar box and crushed violets on the nose. Medium-bodied blackberry, thyme, cloves, and then black currant and minerals on the back. Very fine chalky tannins at the end. 30 year old wine for my 30th birthday üéâ

Region: Margaux, France
Alcohol: 13%
Grapes: Bordeaux red blend
Vibrant scent of dark berries and cherries. Remarkable fruit that comes through the earthy and spicy tones. Robust ripe tannins that give a good medium to full mouth feel.
Pencil shaves , nice fruits mineral and soft and fruity. I found quite a lot residual sugar for this (some agreed) that's the part I don't like. Kill the elegance but quite some others don't mind.
M, violet, red plum, chocolate, minerality, m+ intensity m+ finish.
I could not find the significant difference in the structure from Napa bordeaux. Less oak and tannin compared with Napa. I drunk too much today so would like to try again while I am focused ÔºÅ

Striking deep berry crimson colour
Soft nose showing great potential
Lovely rich firm palate showing firm wonderful acid and tannins and good fruit with a long firm finish
I didn't get any of the raffinement, elegance and feminity that usually connects with Margaux. The balance is a bit off with a strong structure but lower intensity of aromas and flavor
4 stars because it needs to age more . Beautiful nose , berries such as raspberries and wild strawberry , hint of chocolate as well . Beautiful aftertaste for a wine that own your palate till the end
A bit disappointed with this second growth! Can't find the elegance from this Margaux. The wine is too dry and close, only graphite and minerals. Add a little fruit after breathed for a long time.
Not a bad wine. Flavors were a little muted. Good earth but almost was overpowered by the burgers we paired it with. Would drink again but could find something better for the price.
Mature, tertiary notes of boiled mushroom, leather, game and earthiness dominate while offering little fruits and tannins. Palate has thinning flavors and lacks structure. Time to drink up.
Clear, medium ruby; clean nose, medium intensity with red fruit, liquorice, smoky  cedar; dry, medium acidity, medium tannin, medium body and alcohol, medium length with a red fruit liquroice finish.
Initially stronger showing of fruit, with dark cherry, graphite, dried strawberry. Angular and rough tannins with bright acidity. Hint of oak, cloves and vanilla. Hint of perfume.
Fully mature. Coffee and chocolate nose with barely any fruit. Balanced and structured, but missing those amazing tertiary notes the best Bordeaux have. Long and clean licorice finish.
3.8pts. Always a delight. RS is always well balanced and elegant; perhaps not as punchy as the Ch Mgx but definitely a soft and highly approachable cousin that does not disappoint.

Ok. We had a bad start of the day but a good finish of the holidays.

On the nose intense aromas of cherry and berry fruits. Full of fruit which follows also on the palate. 

Tannins are present and, although resolved, quite acrid. It is a great wine. However, it doesn't really develop fully in the mouth and finishes rather abruptly. Behind It's drinking window?

96 Bordeaux Tasting 5/8

This wine I think suffered slightly from being the wine after the wine of the night. I thought it was a bit more floral than others and had a violet/tar note that oddly reminded me of a barbaresco. 

Elegant rounded mouthfeel. Rated it highly but didnt make too many notes.

4.25*

disappointed with this actually.. alot of cedar, dark currants and plums but none of the elegance and refinement of sweet cassis i associate with aged bordeaux nor the leathery and persistent finish.. very average for me at this point and frankly sparse and uninspiring..

PNP followed over the night. This was delightful for the first five hours, elegant body, with lovely floral notes and red and black fruit, fresh and soft tannins. Wet earth and truffles. After 4-5 hours the fruit faded and this became more austere.  Bottle was from auction.

Hands down, my favorite '90s vintage of Rauzan-Segla. Very pretty, neat, everything in its proper place. Lovely, silky middle. Good typicity too. Nothing not to like here (for me, anyway). Shows its pedigree. Love it.

I like Margaux but have no chance to try it until at Wine & Dine.

Nose of red and black fruits, tobacco & spice. On the palate, black fruits, plum, oak and smooth tannins. Medium bodied. Nice wine.

However, it was not served at right temperature. Its a bit warm in the mouth. üò•

A little disappointed about this one, a bit too vague in character for what you would expect at this price. Underneath some layers there is more that could fold out - maybe in time. Not really in balance now.

An intense complex blend of CS60,Merlot38&PVerdot2 with sweet red and black fruits and unsmoked cigar tobacco, spices. Sweet cassis, black cherry, licorice, tobacco leaf and spice box with a long life

The color is a clear, deep, rich purple.  The nose is a succulent mix of plums and blackberries with a little sweetness of cassis.  The flavors on the palate are a complex mix of leather, blackberries, oak, and plums which manifest all at the same time in a very dramatic way.  The body is bold and dry with high tannins and medium acid.  Alcohol is 13.5%.  A lovely discovery!

Ruby-garnet in colour, medium intensity on the nose with rounded tannins and medium alcohol. Need a longer period of decanting probably 2-3 hours or more to bring the best of it. Clear initial note was mushroom, oak, dark fruit. Was expecting more from it.

Nice Bordeaux. Dark red with notes of black fruit and oak on the nose. Opens to flavors of pomegranate, anise and vanilla on the palate. A bit flat and lifeless. Not sure if that was a bottle issue or a vintage issue, but I expected a bit more liveliness.

Impressed by the youthfulness expressed in this bottle! You can really tell this blend is very cab heavy, but what strikes me is the freshness of the dark fruits and berries! 

53% Cabarnet Sauvignon, 40% Merlot, 7% Petit Verdot & Cabarnet Franc. Youthful feel, maybe more time in the cellar.. Decanted for some time, (can‚Äôt remember for how long tbh) so was really given the chance to open up, but the opinions was divided around the table, some loved it, some.. well.. really liked it! ;)

Hot vintage! I love that. Anytime you discuss ‚Äò03 Bdx. üòÄ This was classic, but still pretty tannic. The pros at the table said it needs a few more years. These devolve for me over time. This was in a good spot, but I‚Äôll still don‚Äôt love Bdx. Fruit was nice and it‚Äôs balanced. For me, ready now.

Tasted blind.  The perfume nose, leather, pencil, earth, cocoa nose was very seductive.  Kept returning to it.  Body wise was still not ready and not shinning as much as the nose.  Fruits felt light, acidity medium minus, and structure a lot weaker esp in the mid palate.

Nose, seductive, kept forcing you to come back to it. 

Blind guess, left bank, margaux 2012 or 2014 due to weaker fruits and ultimately decided on 2014.  Always those 50:50 moments.

110722 - quick luncheon & tasted blind with MWL vinos. 
Rather intense ruby core with very slight sign of aging at its rims.
Nose; perfume & seductive. Plenty of berries, potpourri, pencil lead, tobacco and freshly dried tea leaves.
Palate; medium body, mid-to-high acidity. Rather thin mid-palate that did not live up to the nose. Not as much fruits and secondary flavors that I would want. Slight grip of tannins but lacks the depth & structure.

Blind guess - lb margaux, 2014 vintage. Missed by couple of years
Purple colour. After 2 hrs breath, nose with black fruit. Medium to full bodies, rich and structural tannins, acidity, balance.

Decanted this for a few hours and realise there is a lot more structure and remaining life to this than originally thought. The finish is not that strong but the whiff of pencil shavings was very pleasant. There's enough here to let it evolve for many more years.

Deep rich red colour, vibrant nose full of floral tones with a deep wooded and tobacco base. Mid body wine with a firm tannin structure but not overpowering the subtle notes.  A wonderful wine that is drinking well now.

Certainly past prime but nonetheless holding up remarkably well. Surprisingly rich color with only a little bricking, and there's even still some fruit, although the more dominant flavors are dried leaves and funk. Would have been curious to try this 15 years ago, but still--not half bad...

‚Äò01 vintage. Strong tones of ruby and purple with faded garnet rims. Initially quiescent, this margaux blossomed fully over 2-3 hours of decanting. Medium bodied full of red to dark fruit. Ripe black cherry and blackcurrant compote. Smooth tannins with a plush and round body. Toasty oak with minimal intrusion from tobacco and mushroom. Less herbaceous than fruity, this wine flourished at a peak of 3-4 hours. Great structure, fantastic flavour, one to savour. A gilded expression of a less famous vintage. 4.2

First wine for this new year reunion dinner.
Colours are still intense and dark garnet despite the years. Closed subdued nose,black fruits, pepper.  On the palate, bold yet light with powdery tannins,  leather, wonderful elegant finish. Good stuff...

Tried it from blind tasting, bramble and dark fruity scents on the nose, I knew it from a old vintage, it‚Äôs really hard for a right bank goes with full fruity with just little of old wine signs. Guessed it right from left bank and it‚Äôs good.

Birth year wine for me, always an added pleasure. Finely aged nose of cherry confit, sousbois, fragrant soil. mildly spicy notes as well like roasting coriander seeds. Cool and smooth on the palate. I guessed way off, St. Julien 2001. Really tremendous stuff.

Very good, secondary flavours mostly but opens with a lovely perfumed nose - black cherries, some leather, hints of graphite and some well baked spice like cinnamon and nutmeg. Elegant, lovely and well aged. Don‚Äôt decant too long, 30 mins is sufficient to enjoy the subtleties of the wine.

Had this in double magnum at my wife's 50th birthday party. Unfortunately it was corked but the wine itself was not much affected maybe because it's 4 bottle equivalent. A perfect bottle would have easily been 4+ stars

Cabernet Sauvignon dominance, Merlot, and tiny Cabernet Franc. Nice structure with richness in intensity of ripe red fruit and black currant. Delicates tannin with well balanced acidity. Hint of vanilla. Beautiful Margaux.

The nose shows black currant leafs, blackberries, plum and sour cherries.
A touch of vanilla. Very well integrated oak.
The palate has sharp acidity, it‚Äôs lean with firm and under ripe tannins. Fair length.
Quite boring for a wine with this reputation and price range.

4.2 - Sunday lunch roast beef deserves a classy Bordeaux !

Deep garnet with legs.  A nose that is more St Est√®phe than Margaux but none the worse for it!  Dark plum, ink, aged wood, leather and decomposing leaves üçÅ üçÇ, cold embers, graphite.  Low alcohol, m. acidity, m(-) body, m(-) fully resolved tannins.  M(+) dark prunes, espresso, graphite, cr√™me de m√ªre and mild green tomato leaf note.  Long, effortlessly elegant finish.

So much value in this ex-Ch√¢teau, 18 year old 2nd growth Margaux üòçüòúüç∑!

Colour: Dark burgundy with pale rim. Flecks of browning. 
Aroma: darker notes: soy sauce, dried mushrooms, leather and olives. Hint of methol still whiffs in an out of existence. 
20m later: 
Palate: medium acidity, tannins still firm, Almost stern. Medium body. Youthful structure. 
Aftertaste: long, flashes of cigar box

Caught the wine at its awkward period. Very promising aromas, while the palate is hollow; devoid of any fruit, very tight n close. Sharp acidity n bitterness prevails. I reckon the wine is in hibernation, too young to drink now. I would cellar any remaining bottles for another 10-12 years before any attempt to taste it again.

No fruit in  the nose or palate, really quite funky with leather,  truffle and pipe  tobacco quite dominant. The palate is really complex with flavors of black tea, graphite and some oak nuances.  Really liked this but not for everyone.

A lighter style of Margaux, with a delicate, complex nose of juicy berries, oak, sweet spices.
A bright, fresh, red fruit and earthy palate presence. 
Finish characterised by the return of berries and oak. Good length.

First time having this 2nd growth! It's bold, toasty, gamey notes, meat, leather, oak, spice & tobacco; No sign of fruits! 20 years of ageing and i reckoned it will stop developing. Now is the best time to drink! No doubts still delicious, complex and long finishing! It may not be the best year, but this still best represent Margaux. 93 points!

Persistent nose of baked cherries and spices. Dried red fruits, more spices, red peppers and minerals. Light bodied, the tannins and acidity are still very much present but i feel the fruit has started to fade and tje wine has started its decline. Decant for at least an hour and a half.

Complicated developed with dry black fruit, forest, lavender and cedar. Medium acidity, medium body with long finish. Although the structure still intact, it showed a feeling for downhill. Can pair duck meal well. 44% CS, 51% merlot, 5% petit Verdot. Not my favorite style.

Drinking well. 

Not a fan of bdx but this made sense. 

A hint of brett and barnyard, earthy notes, licorice and spiced plum, wood and chocolate. 

Lost weight and currently svelte, w/ a nice fruit profile on the palate, yielded a quick pop of ripe fruit that transitioned into tart fruit and savory spice, with lively acidity and just the right amt of unresolved tannin tt provided texture; good length on the finish.

Game, meat. A little stinky in the first. Then leather, dirt and over cooked dark fruit nose. Thankfully the palate is ok with dark fruit, casis and a little spic. Medium acidity but medium minis in tannin.

This particular bottle was corked - unfortunately the last of my case. From the 5 previous bottles: a classic Margaux, not in the sense of what has been made in the 2000s though - dark purple core with beautiful brick coloured rim on the glass. Cassis and dark forest berries. Powerful and masculine, oily and dense. Mature and absolutely beautiful today - probably has another 5-8 years in it though.

I‚Äôm amazed by this 24 years old and absolutely no signs of ageing. No brown edges and the primary fruit is still punching strong. Lovely cherry and blackberry bramble with hints of pencil shavings rounded off with some figs and raisins. Lovely, only slight criticism is finish could be a bit longer.

This is probably hovering around 3.7 or 3.8 at the moment.  I'm not sure how much it will evolve over time as I found the wine pretty thin.  It massively improves with some time and the rather dull nose opens up to give tea leaves, cigars and a dash of earthiness.  The palate is what disappointed me a little as I was expecting a fuller body and some fruit.  The fruit is almost non-existent although there's a good balance of tannins and acidity.  Shortish finish. Was 2003 a difficult vintage?

Minerally, red and black berry fruit, touch tobacco. Tannins soft, good acidity, excellent length. Full bodied, slightly over extracted tannic bitterness not detracting. Drinking well and no sign of decline.

Ruby. Far from showing signs of age. Nose is kinda disappointing even for an elegant wine. I get raspberry, blackberry, a green component, balsamic and a toasted note. Medium body. Balanced with well integrated tannins. Finish is medium long but has a alcoholic feeling I think. For these price level, I would expect more.

Compared to the Pontet Canet we had the day before it lacks a bit of zing. Exact same price point but it has more acidity and sour cherry notes. Still lovely wine and definitely at its peak, but not as exciting or well rounded as some other examples of the vintage. Still it's a wine I would recommend you try and enjoy.

4.3 @ home in Shanghai
Under lockdown day 30, and 1st day of May GW. Mid purple color. Aroma of black and red berries, plum, nuance of leather, and especially violet which is one of the specification of Margaux is nice. Silky tannin and elegant body. Wonderful Margaux wine with ribeye steak.

Beautiful wine: round and plummy. Unfortunately, at it's best after a 90-minute decant, an hour before dinner, by which time it had begun to fall off, and be overwhelmed by the Gigondas-based sauce mad√®re.

Hue of deep ruby

Nose: Black berry, black plum, floral (violets), musk, graphite, smoke, vanilla. Palate: Dry, M+ bright acidity, M+palate, M+tannins. M+finish with vanilla, blackberry. Ripe, mellow tannins.

Classic Margaux. Perfumed with a great balance. Plenty of years left. Chose the 2010 over the 2005 which was also on the wine list for a younger Bordeaux body. Could definitely sleep for another 15 years but enjoyable all the same.

Another good reminder that top bordeaux vintages don't reveal their age. My first instinct was 1981 St Julien because of this leafy, undergrowth character. I was off by a respectable 22 years. The core was still very dark with only a mahogany coloured rim. It confirmed the classic backward character of the 59s, a vintage built to last forever but without the charm and fruit of 61. Not a crowdpleaser but a sincere old school bordeaux.

This 1984 is well  beyond its peak. Fruitiness has faded and acidity as well. Still some good tannins and after 1 hour of air it was at its best. Anyway as it is a cab sav its faded taste still was good enought for the meat.

Smooth and soft with medium tannins. Raspberry, blackberry, liquorice and coffee. So pleasant to drink.

Positive: worked when switched to laptop. Good technical data sheets that give a lot of additional background to the weather conditions, picking, vinification etc.

Finely aged Bordeaux! Fig and prune marmalade at the nose, with a hint of grass that gives up the Cabernet franc. Still in very good condition with intense acidity and tannins. Full bodied. Long finish. Great for heavy meats.

A typical Margaux opening doors to more Margaux. Aside from the usual flavours you can find in a Bordeaux blend (the black fruits and oak and subtle vanilla plus the elegance), there is also a small hint of coaco giving you a wonderful finishing to the wine, lasting a medium length. 
Full body and smooth requiring probably just 30-45min decanting, this wine is your perfect companion for after dinner gossips with smoked cheese.

Deep ruby color despite being nearly 20 years old. Nose is still youthful, with floral notes hitting me first, then black currant and tobacco. Med bodied, med acidity, and a lush, round mouthfeel. This wine still has another 10 years in it if you've got the patience.

Tasted blind.

Matt, medium depth, orange tinge. Good rim. Medium viscosity.

Very tannic and lean. Hard, rough, masculine, bitter. Alcohol. Light body. (Too much oak for such a light bodied wine). Tail docked. Lacks acidity in the finish ->82

Beautiful drinking now, showing great dark berries on the nose, just fantastic perfume of fresh fruit. Rather typical of its origins in many ways, as the palate is delicate and silky smooth. Great length and just a mouth filling opulent wine, which explodes with complexity, layers of leather, cedar, oak, cassis, vanilla and then minerals and restraint as it settles. A tightly wrapped package overall, sensationally structured wine, will just keep going in the cellar as the balance is pretty much perfect.

on the nose this seems much older than it really is. opened up quite nicely after half an hour (had the 375 format which may be the reason)  on the palette, strong flavor of far dark berry, leather,  plum,  and cedar box. still quite a decent finish. just the right time to enjoy now

Surprisingly vibrant and fruity flagrance permeated when I opened up the bottle. Dark red. Good staining on the cork. Nose of ripe plum and berries. Medium plus body, tannic, dry, balanced but acidity on the higher side.  

It was still too strong and had a heavy aftertaste for me even after 1+ hour of decanting. Started to become smoother overtime as I drank slowly and let it breathe for approx. 3 hours. 

4.1 in May 2020. Will try another bottle in a few years

Blend: 57% Cabernet Sauvignon and 43% Merlot

It had a lovely fragrant nose, as you would expect from Margaux. Blackcurrants and cassis, leather and spice on the palate. Nice ripe tannins. It really opened up after decanting and got better the longer I left it. I had it with steak and it went down a treat. I would buy it again and I would love to try it in 5 years time.

Terrific nose - sweet plum scent, seductive and intoxicating - it took almost an hour to open up. Very jammy fruits, ripe, smooth. Medium body. Easy to drink. Doesn't feel like it has high alcohol content. Yum!

Opened on 30th at 7pm, strong earthy, barnyard, leather smell. Could not drink as there was too much wine, used tge hand vac and removed tge air as much as possible and put it one wine fridge
Opened it on 31st at 4pm, the earthy bouquet toned down, more fruit. The taste is typical of an aged Bordeaux but the finish is way too quick, almost immediate. No tannins, just pure pleasurable fruit

Had this at a friends party. All primary fruit flavours are almost gone now, the usual leather of aged cab sav on the nose is the first to hit you. Hints of pencil lead, cigars, toasts and cassis. Still have years more in it, would rate it a 3.9.

Capping off a wine-filled weekend with an elegant wine of age shared with colleagues and friends. #RauzanSegla 1989. Classy and fresh at 26. It's sweet perfume seduces the palate and soothes the soul. Cheers! #Bordeaux

Drunk Easter Sunday 2020 from own cellar. Decanted first 2 hrs. Very little sediment thrown. A hint of tawny colour in the glass. Fabulous structure with moderated tannins and balanced acidity. Ripe fruit with pronounced peppermint and leather. Still on it‚Äôs plateau and absolutely perfect.

2009 chateau Rauzan-Segla, bright red colour with shine replection clear medum + viscosity, good nose parfumi red and black barry nose with yet ripe tanin smooth and firm  black berry, red cheery and hight tanin abd long finish good with wagyu sirloin 9+ can keep for another 15 years
Soft and balanced nose, red berries  on the palate, very light. Highly overpriced, had very high expectations, rather dissapointing experience.
